bf0caa21-64a5-4bc6-b9f4-af0968c8e109.description: Badge earners are able, in addition to the knowledge and comprehension of TOGAF 9 Foundation, to analyze and apply this knowledge. This includes the terminology, structure, and concepts of the TOGAF 9 Standard. It includes understanding the core principles of Enterprise Architecture, the TOGAF ADM Phases, the TOGAF Content Metamodel, TOGAF ADM tools and techniques, as well as approaches for adapting the TOGAF ADM.
bf0caa21-64a5-4bc6-b9f4-af0968c8e109.name: The Open Group Certified: TOGAF® 9 Certified

badge_template_activities.title: Certification is open to all applicants – there is no requirement for any previous certification.

To achieve certification to the TOGAF 9 Certified Body of Knowledge a Candidate must complete the 13 Level 1 Learning Units  and the 27 Level 2 Learning Units defined in the Conformance Requirements Document and pass the TOGAF 9 Part 1 and the TOGAF 9 Part 2 examinations.

Candidates are required to have passed both the TOGAF 9 Part 1 examination and the TOGAF 9 Part 2 examination. The examinations may be taken separately or together as a combined examination. The Part 1 examination consists of 40 questions in simple multiple choice format with a 55% pass mark. The Part 2 examination consists of 8 gradient scored complex scenario-based questions with a 60% pass mark.

Details of the learning paths and applicable examinations: for candidates who want to do stepwise learning two separate exams can be taken — for candidates who want to achieve this certification in one step, they can take a single exam.
The duration of certification is indefinite – certification is to a given version of the Body of Knowledge and does not expire, so there are no re-certification or renewal requirements.
See here for the official Directory of Certified individuals.

a794bf5c-a23b-4a9e-9778-da52090082d5.description: The badge earner has demonstrated knowledge and understanding, including analysis and application, of the TOGAF Standard, Version 9.2.
a794bf5c-a23b-4a9e-9778-da52090082d5.name: The Open Group Certified: TOGAF® Standard, Version 9.2

alignments.name: The TOGAF Standard, Version 9.2 (Doc. No. C182)

badge_template_activities.title: There are multiple paths to earn this badge:
Either (1) the earner has earned the TOGAF 9 Certified badge and has updated their knowledge by earning the TOGAF Essentials 2018 badge
or (2) the earner has earned the TOGAF 9 Certified badge and has  completed an accredited training course for the TOGAF Standard, Version 9.2
or (3) the earner has earned the TOGAF 9 Certified badge after November 1, 2019

7cd76691-1cec-4ec7-88f8-3e669350630b.description: Badge earners have knowledge of the terminology, structure, and basic concepts of the TOGAF 9 Standard, and understand the core principles of Enterprise Architecture and the TOGAF Standard.
7cd76691-1cec-4ec7-88f8-3e669350630b.name: The Open Group Certified: TOGAF® 9 Foundation

badge_template_activities.title: Certification is open to all applicants – there is no requirement for any previous certification.

To achieve certification to the TOGAF 9 Foundation Body of Knowledge, Candidates must complete the 13 Level 1 Learning Units defined in the Conformance Requirements Document and pass the TOGAF 9 Part 1 examination.

The TOGAF 9 Part 1 examination is the assessment for the TOGAF 9 Foundation certification. This examination comprises 40 questions in simple multiple choice format, covering the Level 1 learning outcomes (see the Conformance Requirements Document for detail). The pass mark is 55% (22 or more questions out of a maximum of 40).
The duration of certification is indefinite – certification is to a given version of the Body of Knowledge and does not expire, so there are no re-certification or renewal requirements.

a35d5ab3-35f2-4b72-9c2a-6697af86e806.description: Master Certified Solution Architects create formalized descriptions of solutions to business problems and opportunities developed through the reasoned application of technologies, people, and processes to successfully deliver systems and capabilities that support the needs of the business. Typical job titles within this discipline include IT Architect, System Architect, Delivery Architect, Security Architect, and Infrastructure Architect. (Open CA SA L2).
a35d5ab3-35f2-4b72-9c2a-6697af86e806.name: Professional Certification: Level 2 - Master Certified Solution Architect

badge_template_activities.title: Master Certified Solution Architects achieve Certification by successfully completing three interviews by other Level 2 or Level 3 Certified Architects, based upon a comprehensive package of information describing project and other experiences.  The criteria used to decide on certification include all of the Skills mentioned above.  At Level 2, Architects must be able to demonstrate these skills at a "deep" level, having mastered the state of the art.

Master Certified Solution Architects must have at least 3 years of  Architecture work experience in one or more projects or engagements in which they were accountable for the  Architecture aspects and must have performed in the role of Lead Architect on successful architectural engagements or projects that met their acceptance criteria.

Master Certified Solution Architects have a variety of experiences that demonstrate their contribution to successful solutions to complex problems covering e.g., people, process, technology, and management, and involving at least four dimensions (products, technologies, services, processes, management, security, governance, etc.) and/or domains (Business, Data, Information, Application, Technology, Security, Integration, etc.).
Master Certified Solution Architects have experience producing solutions that involve different types of systems/architectures and multiple hardware and software platforms.

A Master Certified Solution Architect's experience must include the solution lifecycle from strategy, design, and implementation through to completion, enabling the Architect to produce solution designs that are successful.

Master Certified Solution Architects must have completed formal training in the discipline of architecture (i.e., methods/frameworks for designing and defining solution architectures), either through attendance at a taught course, or through self-study, and are expected to continue to develop their skills and to stay up-to-date with the development of their profession.
Master Certified Architects must continually develop their technical and professional knowledge and skills in technology trends, vertical industry sectors, and architecture trends and techniques.

Master Certified Architects must make contributions to the architecture profession; for example, architecture-related publications, research collaboration, development of training, or contributions to standards bodies or professional organizations.  They must also contribute to the development of professional architects through teaching, serving on certification boards, coaching, and/or mentoring.

Candidates must alreday hold valid Open CA Level 2 Professional Communication and  Professional Development Milestone Badges plus three Open CA Level 2 Experience Profile Milestone Badges, at least two of which must be in Solution Artchitecture

2ad41abb-bc33-4d27-a154-5aadfbc647f7.description: Solution Architects create formalized descriptions of solutions to business problems and opportunities developed through the reasoned application of technologies, people, and processes to successfully deliver systems and capabilities that support the needs of the business. Typical job titles within this discipline include IT Architect, System Architect, Delivery Architect, Security Architect, and Infrastructure Architect. (Open CA SA L1)
2ad41abb-bc33-4d27-a154-5aadfbc647f7.name: Professional Certification: Level 1 - Certified Solution Architect

badge_template_activities.title: Certified Solution Architects achieve Certification by successfully completing an interview by a Level 2 or Level 3 Certified Architect, based upon a comprehensive package of information describing project and other experiences.  The criteria used to decide on certification include all of the Skills mentioned above. At Level 1, Architects must be able to demonstrate these skills at an "applied" level, perhaps with support and mentoring.

Certified Solution Architects must have at least 2 years of experience of contributing to the development of the architectural aspects of one or more  projects or engagements, possibly with support or mentoring, and must have participated in the role of Architect in two successful, complex architectural engagements or projects

Certified Solution Architects have a variety of experiences that demonstrate their contribution to successful solutions to complex problems covering e.g., people, process, technology, management, and involving more than one dimension (products, technologies, services, processes, management, security, governance, etc.) and/or domain (Business, Data, Information, Application, Technology, Security, Integration, etc.)
Certified Solution Architects have experience producing solutions that involve more than one type of technology and/or architecture.
Certified Solution Architects must have demonstrated their appreciation of the impact of their architectural decisions on the realization and operation of a solution.

A Certified Architect's experience must include the understanding and appreciation of the solution lifecycle from strategy, design, and implementation through to completion, enabling the them to produce solution designs that are successful.

Certified Architects must have completed formal training in the discipline of architecture (i.e., methods/frameworks for designing and defining solution architectures), either through attendance at a taught course, or through self-study.
Certified Architects must continually develop their technical and professional knowledge and skills in technology trends, vertical industry sectors, and architecture trends and techniques.

Candidates must hold valid Open CA Level 1 (or 2)  Professional Communication and  Professional Development Milestone Badges plus two Open CA Level 1 Experience Profile Milestone Badges, at least one of which must be in Solution Architecture

e5a41bfb-0064-41a8-b149-1c7b2b39476f.description: Badge earners have knowledge of the notation, terminology, structure, and basic concepts of the ArchiMate modeling language, and have the capability to use the ArchiMate language for modeling.
e5a41bfb-0064-41a8-b149-1c7b2b39476f.name: The Open Group Certified: ArchiMate® 3 Practitioner

badge_template_activities.title: Certification is open to all applicants -- there is no requirement for any previous certification.

The path to achieve certification to the ArchiMate 3 Practitioner Body of Knowledge is as follows: Complete the 14 Level 1 Learning Units and the 13 Level 2 Learning Units defined in the Conformance Requirements Document and pass the ArchiMate 3 Part 1 and the ArchiMate 3 Part 2 examination.
The ArchiMate 3 Part 1 and ArchiMate 3 Part 2 examinations are the standard assessment for the ArchiMate 3 Practitioner certification.
The duration of certification is indefinite -- certification is to a given version of the Body of Knowledge and does not expire, so there are no re-certification or renewal requirements.
See here for the official Directory of Certified Individuals

89383a77-9c43-42cb-b1c0-e46ad1f1f77f.description: Badge earners have knowledge of the notation, terminology, structure, and basic concepts of the ArchiMate modeling language.
89383a77-9c43-42cb-b1c0-e46ad1f1f77f.name: The Open Group Certified: ArchiMate® 3 Foundation

badge_template_activities.title: Certification is open to all applicants -- there is no requirement for any previous certification.

To achieve certification to the ArchiMate 3 Foundation Body of Knowledge, Candidates must complete the 14 Level 1 Learning Units defined in the Conformance Requirements Document and pass the ArchiMate 3 Part 1 examination.

The ArchiMate 3 Part 1 examination is the assessment for the ArchiMate 3 Foundation certification.  This examination comprises 40 questions in simple multiple choice format, covering the Level 1 learning outcomes (see the Conformance Requirements Document for detail). The pass mark is 60% (24 or more questions out of a maximum of 40).
The duration of certification is indefinite -- certification is to a given version of the Body of Knowledge and does not expire, so there are no re-certification or renewal requirements.

e5110f0a-1127-4ac6-937f-016fb26325d4.description: Distinguished Architects are recognized as leaders of the Profession. They develop architectures for complex projects that significantly impact the businesses of their employers or clients. They identify client needs, apply industry knowledge, and devise business and technology solutions to address those needs. Distinguished Certified Architects are a source of innovation and excellence, able to deliver effectively across multiple business units and geographies. (Open CA L3)
e5110f0a-1127-4ac6-937f-016fb26325d4.name: Professional Certification: Level 3 - Distinguished Architect

badge_template_activities.title: Distinguished Architects must previously have been certified by The Open Group at Level 2 - Master Certified Architect, or the equivalent in a program accredited by The Open Group.

Distinguished Architects achieve Certification by successfully completing three interviews by other Distinguished Certified Architects.  The interview criteria include all of the skills listed above, as well as the requirements for successful leadership of architecture engagements that had a significant, positive impact on the business of their employers/clients.

Distinguished Architects must have repeated experience successfully directing significantly complex architecture initiatives, developing solutions that typically involve different stakeholders, multiple lines of business, many solution varieties, highly regulated environments, (de)mergers, acquisitions, business transformations, international and/or global scale, etc.
Distinguished Architects must have repeated experience successfully directing projects and developing solutions that result in significant positive and measurable business value and/or impact.
Distinguished Architects must have repeated experience in setting and driving architecture goals and objectives for significant strategic enterprise initiatives.
Distinguished Architects must continually develop their technical and professional knowledge and skills in technology trends, vertical industry sectors, and architecture trends and techniques.

Distinguished Architects must make contributions to the architecture profession, such as publications, research, development of training, or contributions to standards bodies or professional organizations.  They must also contribute to the development of professional architects through teaching, serving on certification boards, coaching, and/or mentoring.

Candidates must previously have been certified at Level 2 - Master Certified Architect, or the equivalent in a program accredited by The Open Group.  Candidates must also hold a valid Open CA Level 3 Professional Development Milestone Badge, plus three Level 3 Open CA Experience Profile Milestone Badges

825a1670-0406-43fd-9538-68684ba5d7fc.description: Badge earners have knowledge of the notation, terminology, structure, and basic concepts of the ArchiMate modeling language, and have the capability to use the ArchiMate language for modeling. This certification is based on the ArchiMate 2.1 Specification.
825a1670-0406-43fd-9538-68684ba5d7fc.name: The Open Group Certified: ArchiMate® 2 Certified

badge_template_activities.title: Certification is open to all applicants – there is no requirement for any previous certification.

Candidates are required to have completed the Learning Units defined in the Conformance Requirements document and pass both the ArchiMate 2 Part 1 examination and the ArchiMate 2 Part 2 examination. The examinations may be taken separately or together as a combined examination. The Part 1 examination consists of 40 questions in simple multiple choice format with a 60% pass mark. The Part 2 examination consists of 8 gradient scored complex scenario-based questions with a 70% pass mark.
The ArchiMate 2 Part 1 and ArchiMate 2 Part 2 examinations are the standard assessment for certification for the ArchiMate 2 Certified credential.

The duration of certification is indefinite – certification is to a given version of the Body of Knowledge and does not expire, so there are no re-certification or renewal requirements. For candidates who wish to advance to ArchiMate 3 Practitioner, they may do so via the ArchiMate 3 Advanced Bridge examination (which is available until January 31 2019)

932e5ee1-acf0-4a15-b00f-3ce399f9faec.description: Badges earners have knowledge of the fundamentals of the Open FAIR Body of Knowledge and understanding of the core principles of risk analysis sufficient to be able to contribute to a risk analysis project.
932e5ee1-acf0-4a15-b00f-3ce399f9faec.name: The Open Group Certified: Open FAIR™ Foundation

badge_template_activities.title: Certification is open to all applicants -- there is no requirement for any previous certification.

To achieve certification to the Open FAIR Foundation Body of Knowledge, Candidates must complete the six Level 1 Learning Units defined in the Conformance Requirements Document and  pass the Open FAIR Part 1 examination.

The Open FAIR Part 1 examination is the assessment for the Open FAIR Foundation certification.  This examination comprises 80 questions in simple multiple choice format, covering the Level 1 learning outcomes (see the Conformance Requirements Document for detail). The pass mark is 70% (56 or more questions out of a maximum of 80).
The duration of certification is indefinite -- certification is to a given version of the Body of Knowledge and does not expire, so there are no re-certification or renewal requirements.
See here for the official Directory of Certified individuals.

72e4a66f-4412-494f-9087-e6c70fd80cce.description: Distinguished Technical Specialists are recognized leaders of their Profession. They develop solutions for complex projects that significantly impact the businesses of their employers or clients. They identify client needs, apply industry knowledge, and devise business and technology solutions to address them. Distinguished Technical Specialists are a source of leadership, innovation and excellence, able to deliver effectively across multiple business units and geographies. (Open CTS L3)
72e4a66f-4412-494f-9087-e6c70fd80cce.name: Professional Certification: Level 3 - Distinguished Technical Specialist

badge_template_activities.title: Distinguished Technical Specialists achieve Certification by successfully completing three interviews by other Distinguished Certified Technical Specialists.  The interview criteria include the skills listed above, as well as the requirements for successful leadership of engagements that had a significant, positive impact on the business of their employers/clients.

Distinguished Technical Specialists must have repeated experience successfully facilitating the implementation of important business initiatives by promoting teaming and cross-organizational participation, and must have Initiated, lead, and influenced multi-disciplinary initiatives across organizational or geographical boundaries, coordinating the activities necessary to succeed

Distinguished Technical Specialists must have repeated experience successfully facilitating the implementation of important business initiatives by promoting teaming and cross-organizational participation, and must have Initiated, lead, and influenced multi-disciplinary initiatives across organizational or geographical boundaries, coordinating the activities necessary to succeed.

Distinguished Technical Specialists have experience of leading with impact, successfully introducing innovations by re-imagining existing problems through the application of new Technical Specialist capabilities.
Distinguished Technical Specialists must have operated at executive levels, conducting complex negotiations, and reaching stable agreements and commitments.
Distinguished Technical Specialists have demonstrated technical leadership in conducting special projects or strategic initiatives that span two or more Specialties.p

Distinguished Technical Specialists continually develop their technical and professional knowledge and skills in technology trends and techniques in the IT industry, and in leadership skills, as well as develop and enhance their knowledge and understanding of the business and industry context of their employers/clients.

Distinguished Technical Specialists make contributions to the profession, such as publications, research, development of training, or contributions to standards bodies or professional organizations that seek to define innovative new technical solutions, strategies, research, or technologies.  They also facilitate the professional development of multiple aspiring Technical Specialists, especially those seeking certification, through teaching, coaching, and/or mentoring.
Candidates must already hold a valid Open CTS Level 3 Professional Development Milestone Badges plus three Open CTS Level 3 Experience Profile Milestone Badges.

062a2838-ebf9-4ba9-871f-3b4655449a10.description: Badge earners have knowledge of the terminology, structure, basic concepts, and core principles of the IT4IT Reference Architecture, and the IT Value Chain.
062a2838-ebf9-4ba9-871f-3b4655449a10.name: The Open Group Certified: IT4IT™ Foundation

badge_template_activities.title: Certification is open to all applicants -- there is no requirement for any previous certification.

To achieve certification to the IT4IT Foundation Body of Knowledge, Candidates must complete the nine Level 1 Learning Units defined in the Conformance Requirements Document and pass the IT4IT Part 1 examination.

The IT4IT Part 1 examination is the assessment for the IT4IT Foundation certification. This examination comprises 40 questions in simple multiple choice format, covering the Level 1 learning outcomes (see the Conformance Requirements Document for detail).  The pass mark is 65% (26 or more questions out of a maximum of 40).
The duration of certification is indefinite -- certification is to a given version of the Body of Knowledge and does not expire, so there are no re-certification or renewal requirements.

7013e6fa-fc1a-4e49-a4db-d0ebea76645a.description: Individuals who have earned the TOGAF Essentials 2018 credential have proven to have up-to-date knowledge and understanding of the changes introduced to the TOGAF Body of Knowledge in 2018, including the TOGAF Standard, Version 9.2 and the TOGAF Library.
7013e6fa-fc1a-4e49-a4db-d0ebea76645a.name: The Open Group Certified: TOGAF® Essentials 2018

alignments.name: The TOGAF Standard, Version 9.2 (Doc. No. C182)

badge_template_activities.title: The earner has attended a minimum of three (3) hours accredited training on the subject and passed the TOGAF Essentials 2018 assessment.
Applicants are required to be TOGAF 9 Certified (TOGAF 9 Level 2).

The path to achieve the TOGAF Essentials 2018 credential is to complete the eight (8) Learning Units defined in the Conformance Requirements document and a pass result for the TOGAF Essentials 2018 assessment.
Candidates are required to have passed the TOGAF Essentials 2018 assessment. The assessment consists of 20 questions in simple multiple-choice format with a 75% pass mark (15/20).
This credential is required for trainers to be authorized to deliver Accredited Training Courses based on the TOGAF Standard, Version 9.2.
The duration of the credential is indefinite – this credential is to a given version of the Body of Knowledge and does not expire, so there are no re-certification or renewal requirements.

0f86ef38-ef23-428d-9462-40e19a9038e1.description: The badge earner has a practical understanding of Enterprise Architecture and modeling including analysis and application using the TOGAF Standard, together with the capability to use the ArchiMate language for modeling.

c269065b-5ffb-46d4-8dcc-796d1a9e38fe.name: The Open Group Certified: TOGAF® Business Architecture Level 1

alignments.name: The TOGAF Standard, Version 9.2 (Doc. No. C182)

badge_template_activities.title: The badge earner has demonstrated their knowledge and understanding of the following topics:  business modeling and how it relates to Enterprise Architecture within a TOGAF context; the concept of business capabilities and how business capabilities can be modeled; applying value streams and value stream mapping;  information mapping; how to apply the TOGAF business scenario method; how a Business Architecture can be developed with the TOGAF ADM.
The path to achieve this credential is to complete the Learning Units defined in the Conformance Requirements document and to obtain a pass result for the Indicator of Compliance.
There are no prerequisites.

The badge earner has achieved a pass result for the TOGAF Business Architecture Part 1 examination. The examination consists of 30 questions in simple multiple-choice format with a 60% pass mark (18/30).
The duration of  this credential is indefinite – this credential is to a given version of the Body of Knowledge and does not expire, so there are no renewal requirements.

c720df3b-e5d4-4058-ad9b-2d5ebdbf86a6.description: The badge earner has a basic understanding of Enterprise Architecture having acquired a basic knowledge and understanding of the TOGAF Standard, Version 9.2 and the ArchiMate® modeling language.

861c7fa5-295a-4290-a87b-32b590a8aba7.description: Technical Specialists in Server Systems have expertise in one or more server technologies, including different hardware architectures and operating systems. Typical examples of the deliverables are proof-of-concept solutions with server system technology and architecting server solutions to address client requirements. Open CTS SV L2
861c7fa5-295a-4290-a87b-32b590a8aba7.name: Professional Certification: Master Certified Technical Specialist, Server Systems

badge_template_activities.title: Master Certified Technical Specialists achieve Certification by successfully completing interviews by three Level 2 or Level 3 Certified Technical Specialists, based upon a comprehensive package of information describing project and other experiences. The criteria used to decide on certification include mastery of all of the Skills mentioned above, as well as the requirement for repeated leadership of successful project engagements.
Master Certified Technical Specialists have had at least 36 months of Full Time Equivalent lead experience, with accountability for the technical aspects within their Specialty.

Master Certified Technical Specialists have performed as a Leader of their Technical Specialty in at least three major client engagements or development, implementation, and/or management of major projects or subsystems.

Master Certified Technical Specialists have performed as a Technical Specialist in at least three successful solution/engagements in which their artifacts were used or otherwise met their acceptance criteria.

Master Certified Technical Specialists  have worked with two or more types of technology/technique and two or more types of architecture, and must have solved a variety of different business problems.
Master Certified Technical Specialists must have completed formal training in Project Management either through attendance at a taught course, or through self-study.

Master Certified Technical Specialists must maintain their knowledge of the technology, trends, and techniques in the IT industry, and must undergo 40 hours per year of training, at a taught course or through self study, related to their Specialty.

Master Certified Technical Specialists must make contributions to the profession through, for example, mentoring, publications, teaching, research collaboration, or participation in professional organizations.

Candidates must already hold valid Open CTS Level 2 Professional Communication and  Professional Development Milestone Badges plus three Level 2 Experience Profile Milestone Badges, at least two of which must be in this Specialty.

f777d003-2e77-48e1-a20e-4d9b0cf59179.description: Master Certified Technical Specialists in Package Application Implementation have expertise in implementing, integrating, and customizing commercial ISV packages such as CRM, ERP, Finance, Accounting, or vertical industry-specific packages. They combine general development knowledge with package knowledge and understanding of the specific domain to which the package relates. Typical deliverables are designs, models, components, code, parameters, unit tests, and documentation. (Open CTS PA L2)
f777d003-2e77-48e1-a20e-4d9b0cf59179.name: Professional Certification: Master Certified Technical Specialist, Package Application Implementation

badge_template_activities.title: Master Certified Technical Specialists achieve Certification by successfully completing three interviews by other Level 2 or Level 3 Certified Technical Specialists, based upon a comprehensive package of information describing project and other experiences.  The criteria used to decide on certification include all of the Skills mentioned above, as well as the requirements for repeated leadership of successful project engagements.

Master Certified Technical Specialitsts typically have eight (8) years of work experience in IT in the last 12 years, that includes the understanding and appreciation of the solution lifecycle from strategy, design, and implementation through to completion, enabling them to produce solution designs that are successful.

Master Certified Technical Specialists have sufficient experience in their chosen Stream/Discipline to demonstrate repeated success in meeting the Stream-specific criteria. Typically, this requires three (3) years of work experience in their Stream/Discipline in the last five (5) years and five (5) years of experience in projects involving two or more Streams/Disciplines in the last eight (8) years.

Master Certified Technical Specialists must have acted in a leadership role in at least three (3) engagements. At least two of the three engagements must have been in connection with projects that met their acceptance criteria.
Master Certified Technical Specialists must have completed formal training in Project Management either through attendance at a taught course, or through self-study.

Master Certified Technical Specialists must maintain their knowledge of the technology, trends, and techniques in the IT industry, and must undergo 40 hours per year of training, at a taught course or through self study, related to their Stream/Discipline.

Master Certified Technical Specialists must make contributions to the profession through, for example, mentoring, publications, teaching, research collaboration, or participation in professional organizations.

Candidates must already hold valid Open CTS Level 2 Professional Communication and  Professional Development Milestone Badges plus three Level 2 Experience Profile Milestone Badges, at least two of which must be in this Specialty.

8855a8f0-9c24-437f-b02f-7a249dd64989.description: Professional Architects are required to have undergone training in architecture methods, to undergo regular development of their professional knowledge and skills, and to contribute to their professional community. (Open CA PD L2)
8855a8f0-9c24-437f-b02f-7a249dd64989.name: Professional Certification: Level 2 Architect - Professional Development Milestone

badge_template_activities.title: Professional Architects must have completed formal training in the discipline of architecture (i.e., methods/frameworks for designing and defining  architectures), either through attendance at a taught course, or through self-study, and to develop and maintain their skills and knowledge in their architecture discipline.
Professional Architects are required to develop and maintain their knowledge of the technology, trends, and techniques that are relevant to developing solutions for solving business problems.
Professional Architects are required to develop and maintain an understanding of their client’s business as it pertains to their client’s vertical industry (e.g., telecoms, financial, etc.).

Candidates must make contributions to the architecture profession; for example, publications, teaching, mentoring, research collaboration, or participation in professional organizations.  Mentoring people in their career progression as Architects is required.
This milestone badge is open to all applicants.  There is no requirement for any previous qualification.

d32a7295-609a-42a8-9068-86943b64991a.description: Certified Technical Specialists in Server Systems have expertise in one or more server technologies, including different hardware architectures and operating systems. Typical examples of the deliverables are proof-of-concept solutions with server system technology and architecting server solutions to address client requirements. Open CTS SV L1
d32a7295-609a-42a8-9068-86943b64991a.name: Professional Certification: Certified Technical Specialist, Server Systems

badge_template_activities.title: Certified Technical Specialists achieve Certification by successfully completing an interview with a Level 2 or Level 3 Certified Technical Specialist, based upon a comprehensive package of information describing project and other experiences. The criteria used to decide on certification include all of the Skills mentioned above.  At Level 1, Technical Specialists must be able to demonstrate these skills at an "applied" level, perhaps with support and mentoring.
Certified Technical Specialists have had at least 24 months of Full Time Equivalent experience, possibly with support or mentoring.

Certified Technical Specialists have participated as a Technical Specialist in at least two successful solutions/engagements in which their artifacts were used or could have been used in the implementation of the solution/component.
Certified Technical Specialists  have worked with at least two types of technology, technique or architecture.
Certified Technical Specialists must have completed formal training in Project Management either through attendance at a taught course, or through self-study.

Certified Technical Specialists must maintain their knowledge of the technology, trends, and techniques in the IT industry, and must undergo 40 hours per year of training, at a taught course or through self study, related to their Specialty.

Candidates must already hold valid Open CTS Level 1 (or 2) Professional Communication and  Professional Development Milestone Badges plus two Experience Profile Milestone Badges, at least one of which must be in this Specialty.

a02fb04f-308c-44f3-9c2b-1c69985360e5.description: Badge earners have knowledge of the notation, terminology, structure, and basic concepts of the ArchiMate modeling language. This certification is based on the ArchiMate 2.1 Specification.
a02fb04f-308c-44f3-9c2b-1c69985360e5.name: The Open Group Certified: ArchiMate® 2 Foundation

badge_template_activities.title: Certification is open to all applicants – there is no requirement for any previous certification.

To achieve certification to the ArchiMate 2 Foundation Body of Knowledge, Candidates must complete the 9 Level 1 Learning Units defined in the Conformance Requirements Document and pass the ArchiMate 2 Part 1 examination.

The ArchiMate 2 Part 1 examination is the assessment for the ArchiMate 2 Foundation certification.  This examination comprises 40 questions in simple multiple choice format, covering the Level 1 learning outcomes (see the Conformance Requirements Document for detail). The pass mark is 60% (24 or more questions out of a maximum of 40).
The duration of certification is indefinite – certification is to a given version of the Body of Knowledge and does not expire, so there are no re-certification or renewal requirements.

5bbd9472-daab-451c-9330-0ab7eaa4f6e8.description: Master Certified Technical Specialists in the the Infrastructure and Application Management stream have expertise in managing and operation of IT hardware, software, communications, and/or application solutions, and the resources required to plan for, develop, deliver, and support properly engineered IT services and products to meet the needs of a business. (Open CTS IAM L2)
5bbd9472-daab-451c-9330-0ab7eaa4f6e8.name: Professional Certification: Master Certified Technical Specialist, Infrastructure and Application Management

badge_template_activities.title: Master Certified Technical Specialists achieve Certification by successfully completing three interviews by other Level 2 or Level 3 Certified Technical Specialists, based upon a comprehensive package of information describing project and other experiences.  The criteria used to decide on certification include all of the Skills mentioned above, as well as the requirements for repeated leadership of successful project engagements.

Master Certified Technical Specialists typically have eight (8) years of work experience in IT in the last 12 years, that includes the understanding and appreciation of the solution lifecycle from strategy, design, and implementation through to completion, enabling them to produce solution designs that are successful.

Master Certified Technical Specialists have sufficient experience in their chosen Stream/Discipline to demonstrate repeated success in meeting the Stream-specific criteria. Typically, this requires three (3) years of work experience in their Stream/Discipline in the last five (5) years and five (5) years of experience in projects involving two or more Streams/Disciplines in the last eight (8) years.

Master Certified Technical Specialists must have acted in a leadership role in at least three (3) engagements. At least two of the three engagements must have been in connection with projects that met their acceptance criteria.
Master Certified Technical Specialists must have completed formal training in Project Management either through attendance at a taught course, or through self-study.

Master Certified Technical Specialists must maintain their knowledge of the technology, trends, and techniques in the IT industry,  and must undergo 40 hours per year of training, at a taught course or through self study, related to their Stream/Discipline.

Master Certified Technical Specialists must make contributions to the profession through, for example, mentoring, publications, teaching, research collaboration, or participation in professional organizations.
Certification is open to all applicants.  There is no requirement for any previous certification.

02e9a528-4add-4564-a849-a62c8481c4e6.description: Master Certified Technical Specialists in Application Integration have expertise in one or more Application and Integration Middleware (AIM)-based software product areas. 772b51ad-f1c9-4641-972e-80f359b8ae40.name: Professional Certification: Master Certified Technical Specialist, Storage Systems

The criteria used to decide on certification include mastery of all of the Skills mentioned above, as well as the requirement for repeated leadership of successful project engagements.
Master Certified Technical Specialists have had at least 36 months of Full Time Equivalent lead experience, with accountability for the technical aspects within their Specialty.

Master Certified Technical Specialists have performed as a Leader of their Technical Specialty in at least three major client engagements or development, implementation, and/or management of major projects or subsystems.

Master Certified Technical Specialists have performed as a Technical Specialist in at least three successful solution/engagements in which their artifacts were used or otherwise met their acceptance criteria.
Master Certified Technical Specialists must have completed formal training in Project Management either through attendance at a taught course, or through self-study.

Master Certified Technical Specialists  have worked with two or more types of technology/technique and two or more types of architecture, and must have solved a variety of different business problems.

a2cd5065-1be6-4961-a076-445cc3efad86.description: Certified Data Scientists work with business leaders to solve problems by understanding, preparing, and analyzing data to predict emerging trends and to provide recommendations to optimize business results. They typically have academic training in a quantitative discipline such as statistics, operations research, machine learning, or econometrics, and combine use of data, analytics tools and languages with strong communication, visualization, and storytelling skills. (Open CDS L1).
a2cd5065-1be6-4961-a076-445cc3efad86.name: Professional Certification: Level 1 - Certified Data Scientist

badge_template_activities.title: Certified Data Scientists achieve Certification by successfully completing an interview by another Level 2 or Level 3 Certified Data Scientist, based upon a comprehensive package of information describing project and other experiences.  The criteria used to decide on certification include all of the Skills mentioned above at an "applied" level, possibly with support and mentoring, as well as the requirement for having solved a variety of Data Science Business Problems.

Certified Data Scientists have performed in the role of a Data Scientist and demonstrated experience using two or more Data Science techniques in at least one project, possibly with supervision or mentoring.
Certified Data Scientists have experience using a variety of data types (e.g., structured, unstructured) and at least one analytic tool (e.g., SPSS, SAS) or language (e.g., Python, R).
Certified Data Scientists have experience of communicating insights and their limitations effectively to at least one stakeholder group, using appropriate visualization techniques.
Certified Data Scientists have demonstrated success in developing Data Science solutions that have met their acceptance criteria and were accepted or adopted by the business.

Certified Data Scientists must have completed formal training in the discipline of Data Science (such as statistics, operations research, machine learning, or econometrics) either through attendance at a taught course, or through self-study, and are required to to continue to develop their skills and to stay up-to-date with the development of their profession.

Certified Data Scientists are required to develop and maintain their knowledge of the technology, trends, and techniques that are relevant to developing solutions for solving business problems, and must maintain an understanding of their client’s business as it pertains to their client’s vertical industry (e.g., telecoms, financial, etc.).
Certified Data Scientists must have demonstrated experience of using reusable assets created by others or of providing assets for reuse. Two examples are required.

Certified Data Scientists must have made contributions to the Data Scientist profession; for example, publications, teaching, mentoring, research collaboration, or participation in professional organizations.  Mentoring is required.
Certification is open to all applicants.

(Open CTS IAM L1)
930609b8-37ba-44c7-bac0-f83ce1669bff.name: Professional Certification: Certified Technical Specialist, Infrastructure and Application Management

The criteria used to decide on certification include all of the Skills mentioned above.

Certified Technical Specialitsts typically, have five (5) years of work experience in IT in the last eight (8) years (excluding time spent under tuition), that includes an understanding of the solution lifecycle, enabling them to contribute to solutions that are successful.

Certified Technical Specialists have sufficient experience in their chosen Stream to demonstrate repeated success in meeting the Stream specific criteria.  Typically, this requires three (3) years of work experience in their Stream in the last five (5) years.

Certified Technical Specialists have acted in the role of IT Specialist within their Stream in at least two (2) successful engagements, and the deliverables they produced must have contributed to the engagement meeting its acceptance criteria.
Certified Technical Specialists must have completed formal training in Project Management either through attendance at a taught course, or through self-study.

Certified Technical Specialists must maintain their knowledge of the technology, trends, and techniques in the IT industry, and must undergo 40 hours per year of training, at a taught course or through self study, related to their Stream/Discipline.
Certification is open to all applicants.  There is no requirement for any previous certification.

9ec00dba-d7cb-43e5-abde-10ec0a2409d2.description: The badge earner has demonstrated their ability to understand essential security and risk concepts in relation to the TOGAF® Architecture Development Method (ADM), Information Security Management (ISM), the broader concept of Enterprise Risk Management (ERM), and the relationships with other IT security and risk standards like the ISO/IEC 27000 family, ISO 31000, and COBIT®.
9ec00dba-d7cb-43e5-abde-10ec0a2409d2.name: The Open Group Certified: Integrating Risk and Security

alignments.name: The TOGAF Standard, Version 9.2 (Doc. No. C182)

badge_template_activities.title: Earners understand: The essential concepts of security and risk, and how to relate to the TOGAF ADM; How IT security and risk standards relate to the TOGAF standard; The concepts of Enterprise Security Architecture (ESA), Enterprise Risk Management (ERM), and Information Security Management (ISM); Why security is a cross-cutting concern; How security and risk principles can be applied to the TOGAF ADM; The relationship between the TOGAF Architecture Content Metamodel and ISM and ERM.
The path to achieve this credential is to complete the Learning Units defined in the Conformance Requirements document and to obtain a pass result for the assessment.
There are no prerequisites.

The Indicator of Compliance for this credential is an assessment made available by The Open Group, or one approved by The Open Group, that is delivered by an Accredited Training Course provider, and which covers the breadth of the Learning Outcomes for the credential. This can take the form of a test, completion of a workbook, an in-course assessment, successful completion of practical (case study, scenario based), or other approved format.
The duration of  this credential is indefinite – this credential is to a given version of the Body of Knowledge and does not expire, so there are no renewal requirements.

7e7848d1-0b17-4de0-ba98-4756f793d7f6.description: The badge earner has gained knowledge of the foundational set of concepts for the Digital Practitioner. The certification is designed to help individuals who wish to create and manage product offerings with an increasing digital component, or lead their organization through Digital Transformation. The learning objectives at this level focus on knowledge and comprehension.
7e7848d1-0b17-4de0-ba98-4756f793d7f6.name: The Open Group Certified: DPBoK™ Foundation

alignments.name: Digital Practitioner Body of Knowledge™ Standard
alignments.description: This standard provides guidance for the Digital Practitioner, whether based in a traditional "IT" organization, manufacturing unit, sales, customer support, or embedded in a cutting-edge integrated product team.

badge_template_activities.title: Certification is open to all applicants -- there is no requirement for any previous certification.

To achieve certification to the DPBoK Foundation Body of Knowledge, Candidates must complete the  Level 1 Learning Units defined in the Conformance Requirements Document and pass the DPBoK Part 1 examination.

The DPBoK Part 1 examination is the assessment for the DPBoK Foundation certification. This examination comprises 40 questions in simple multiple choice format, covering the Level 1 learning outcomes (see the Conformance Requirements Document for detail).  The pass mark is 65% (26 or more questions out of a maximum of 40).
The duration of certification is indefinite -- certification is to a given version of the Body of Knowledge and does not expire, so there are no re-certification or renewal requirements.
See here for the official Directory of Certified individuals.

ad0d9855-8a00-4efe-9007-0966639e3f87.description: Badge earners are able to, in combination with their respective experience, analyze and apply the TOGAF Standard, a proven Enterprise Architecture methodology. Individuals have the following competencies: 1) Know how to apply the TOGAF approach to transform and manage change. 2) Know how to apply the TOGAF method. 3) Know how to apply TOGAF techniques.
ad0d9855-8a00-4efe-9007-0966639e3f87.name: The Open Group Certified: TOGAF® Enterprise Architecture Practitioner

alignments.name: The TOGAF Standard, 10th Edition
alignments.description: The TOGAF® Standard, 10th Edition makes adoption of best practices easier. It will show you where to find enduring and universal concepts and proven best practice and it will also underscore where to look for new emerging ideas.

badge_template_activities.title: Certification is open to all applicants – there is no requirement for any previous certification.

For Candidates with no prior TOGAF Certification: To achieve certification a Candidate must complete the Level 1 and Level 2 Learning Units defined in Section 3 of the TOGAF® Certification Program Conformance Requirements (Multi-Level), Version 4.0 document and pass the applicable examinations.

For Candidates with no prior TOGAF Certification: Candidates are required to have passed both the TOGAF Enterprise Architecture Part 1 examination and the TOGAF Enterprise Architecture Part 2 examination.

For Candidates who hold the TOGAF 9 Certified qualification: To achieve certification a Candidate must complete the Learning Units defined in the TOGAF® Enterprise Architecture Practitioner Bridge Conformance Requirements, Version 1.0 document and pass the applicable examination.
For Candidates who hold the TOGAF 9 Certified qualification: Candidates are required to pass the TOGAF Enterprise Architecture Bridge examination.
The duration of certification is indefinite – certification is to a given version of the Body of Knowledge and does not expire, so there are no re-certification or renewal requirements.
See here for the official Directory of Certified individuals.

Master Certified Data Scientists must have completed formal training in the discipline of Data Science (such as statistics, operations research, machine learning, or econometrics) either through attendance at a taught course, or through self-study, and are required to to continue to develop their skills and to stay up-to-date with the development of their profession.

Master Certified Data Scientists are required to maintain their knowledge of the technology, trends, and techniques that are relevant to developing solutions for solving business problems and must maintain an understanding of their client’s business as it pertains to their client’s vertical industry (e.g., telecoms, financial, etc.).
Master Certified Data Scientists must have demonstrated experience of using reusable assets created by others or of providing assets for reuse. Five examples are required.

Master Certified Data Scientists must make contributions to the Data Scientist profession by mentoring and, for example, publications, teaching, research collaboration, or participation in professional organizations.
Certification is open to all applicants.

badge_template_activities.title: Certified Technical Specialists achieve Certification by successfully completing an interview with a Level 2 or Level 3 Certified Technical Specialist, based upon a comprehensive package of information describing project and other experiences. The criteria used to decide on certification include all of the Skills mentioned above.  At Level 1, Technical Specialists must be able to demonstrate these skills at an "applied" level, perhaps with support and mentoring.
Certified Technical Specialists have had at least 24 months of Full Time Equivalent experience, possibly with support or mentoring.

Certified Technical Specialists have participated as a Technical Specialist in at least two successful solutions/engagements in which their artifacts were used or could have been used in the implementation of the solution/component.

Certified Technical Specialists have acted in the role of IT Specialist within their Stream in at least two (2) successful engagements, and the deliverables they produced must have contributed to the engagement meeting its acceptance criteria.
Certified Technical Specialists  have worked with at least two types of technology, technique or architecture
Certified Technical Specialists must have completed formal training in Project Management either through attendance at a taught course, or through self-study.

Certified Technical Specialists must maintain their knowledge of the technology, trends, and techniques in the IT industry, and must undergo 40 hours per year of training, at a taught course or through self study, related to their Specialty

Candidates must already hold valid Open CTS Level 1 (or 2) Professional Communication and  Professional Development Milestone Badges plus two Experience Profile Milestone Badges, at least one of which must be in this Specialty

90ad2193-141d-443f-8117-05787184dfad.description: Professional Architects need to be able to effectively communicate their topics verbally and in writing – topics that are critical for the continuation of their work, such as architectural decisions and design decisions. (Open CA PC L2)
90ad2193-141d-443f-8117-05787184dfad.name: Professional Certification: Level 2 Architect - Professional Communication Milestone

badge_template_activities.title: Professional Architects exhibit good written communication of architecture related topics, including the use of proper grammar, spelling, document organization, clarity, and use of appropriate content for the audience to meet its purpose

Professional Architects exhibit good verbal communication, with responsiveness to questions, ability to stay on subject, use of good feedback, and follow-up questions, etc., leading to effective two-way communication. Culturally-appropriate body language is expected in face-to-face meetings and video teleconferencing.
This milestone badge is open to all applicants.  There is no requirement for any previous qualification.

1e1ed0eb-859c-4f97-afd1-b2b9da2cb494.description: Professional Architects at Level 3 are required to undergo regular development of their professional knowledge and skills and to contribute to their professional community (Open CA PD L3)
1e1ed0eb-859c-4f97-afd1-b2b9da2cb494.name: Professional Certification: Level 3 Architect - Professional Development Milestone

badge_template_activities.title: Architects are required to develop and maintain their knowledge of the technology trends and techniques that are relevant to developing solutions for solving business problems.
Architects are required to develop and maintain an understanding of their client’s business as it pertains to their client’s vertical industry (e.g., telecoms, financial, etc.).
Architects are required to continually develop their skills and knowledge of the latest architecture-related trends and techniques.

Architects must make contributions to the architecture profession; for example, publications, teaching, mentoring, research collaboration, or participation in professional organizations, and are expected to develop professional architects through teaching, serving on Peer Review Boards, coaching, and/or mentoring.  Coaching/mentoring is mandatory at Level 3.
This milestone badge is open to all applicants.  There is no requirement for any previous qualification.

a2fa2980-172f-4f47-be51-2878a423d48e.description: Badge earners have proven to have up-to-date knowledge and understanding of the changes introduced to the ArchiMate Body of Knowledge in the ArchiMate 3.1 Specification. This credential is required for trainers to be authorized to deliver Accredited Training Courses based on the ArchiMate 3.1 Specification.
a2fa2980-172f-4f47-be51-2878a423d48e.name: The Open Group Certified: ArchiMate® Essentials 3.1

alignments.name: The ArchiMate 3.1 Specification (Doc. No. C197)

badge_template_activities.title: The earner has attended a minimum of three (3) hours training on the subject and passed the ArchiMate Essentials 3.1 assessment.
Applicants are required to be certified to ArchiMate 3 Practitioner (ArchiMate 3 Level 2).

The path to achieve the ArchiMate Essentials 3.1 credential is to complete the Learning Units defined in the Conformance Requirements document and a pass result for the ArchiMate Essentials 3.1 assessment.
Candidates are required to have passed the ArchiMate Essentials 3.1 assessment. The assessment consists of 20 questions in multiple-choice format with a 75% pass mark (15/20).
The duration of the credential is indefinite – this credential is to a given version of the Body of Knowledge and does not expire, so there are no re-certification or renewal requirements.

508d78f6-8802-4470-ad13-bbaab088ef81.description: Master Certified Technical Specialists in Data Platform have expertise in making available, integrating, and optimizing structured and/or unstructured data using database products, technologies, and methods. Open CTS DP L2
508d78f6-8802-4470-ad13-bbaab088ef81.name: Professional Certification: Master Certified Technical Specialist, Data Platform

badge_template_activities.title: Master Certified Technical Specialists achieve Certification by successfully completing interviews by three Level 2 or Level 3 Certified Technical Specialists, based upon a comprehensive package of information describing project and other experiences. The criteria used to decide on certification include mastery of all of the Skills mentioned above, as well as the requirement for repeated leadership of successful project engagements.
Master Certified Technical Specialists have had at least 36 months of Full Time Equivalent lead experience, with accountability for the technical aspects within their Specialty.

Master Certified Technical Specialists have performed as a Leader of their Technical Specialty in at least three major client engagements or development, implementation, and/or management of major projects or subsystems.

Master Certified Technical Specialists have performed as a Technical Specialist in at least three successful solution/engagements in which their artifacts were used or otherwise met their acceptance criteria.

Master Certified Technical Specialists  have worked with two or more types of technology/technique and two or more types of architecture, and must have solved a variety of different business problems.
Master Certified Technical Specialists must have completed formal training in Project Management either through attendance at a taught course, or through self-study.

Master Certified Technical Specialists must maintain their knowledge of the technology, trends, and techniques in the IT industry, and must undergo 40 hours per year of training, at a taught course or through self study, related to their Stream/Discipline.

Master Certified Technical Specialists must make contributions to the profession through, for example, mentoring, publications, teaching, research collaboration, or participation in professional organizations.

Candidates must already hold valid Open CTS Level 2 Professional Communication and  Professional Development Milestone Badges plus three Level 2 Experience Profile Milestone Badges, at least two of which must be in this Specialty.

f9385e61-a305-40e1-b751-e45fdddf5dc3.description: Professional Architects are required to have undergone training in architecture methods, and to regularly develop their professional knowledge and skills. (Open CA PD L1)
f9385e61-a305-40e1-b751-e45fdddf5dc3.name: Professional Certification: Level 1 Architect - Professional Development Milestone

badge_template_activities.title: Professional Architects must have completed formal training in the discipline of architecture (i.e., methods/frameworks for designing and defining  architectures), either through attendance at a taught course, or through self-study, and to develop and maintain their skills and knowledge in their architecture discipline.
Professional Architects are required to develop and maintain their knowledge of the technology, trends, and techniques that are relevant to developing solutions for solving business problems.
Professional Architects are required to develop and maintain an understanding of their client’s business as it pertains to their client’s vertical industry (e.g., telecoms, financial, etc.).
This milestone badge is open to all applicants.  There is no requirement for any previous qualification.

9c1fa960-0396-4d4d-b319-749a5bdd3015.description: Badge earners are able to deliver Agile Architecture in support of Digital Transformation to enable the creation of business value. Key competencies include applying the Open Agile Architecture axioms to develop and maintain Agile Architectures, the application of Agile strategy, business agility, the Agile organization, experience design, design thinking, product architecture, operations architecture, and Agile Security Architecture.
9c1fa960-0396-4d4d-b319-749a5bdd3015.name: The Open Group Certified: Open Agile Architecture™ Practitioner

alignments.name: The Open Agile Architecture Standard

badge_template_activities.title: Certification is open to all applicants – there is no requirement for any previous certification.
To achieve certification the individual must complete the Learning Units defined in the Conformance Requirements Document and pass the Open Agile Architecture Practitioner examination.

Course Syllabus: The role of architecture when deploying Agile at scale • Insights into business agility • Intentional Architecture and Continuous Product Development • Characteristics of an Agile organization • Open Agile Architecture building blocks • Axioms for Agile Architecture • The mental model for Agile Architecture • Digital Transformation and digital products • Lean Value Stream Mapping • Types of Agile Architecture, and when to apply them • Agile Security Architecture.
Individuals are required to have passed the Open Agile Architecture Practitioner examination. The examination consists of 40 questions in multiple choice format with a 70% pass mark.
The duration of certification is indefinite – certification is to a given version of the Body of Knowledge and does not expire, so there are no re-certification or renewal requirements.
See here for the official Directory of Certified individuals.

f1ddddec-040b-4d53-98bb-f47bd197897c.description: Distinguished Data Scientists work with business leaders to solve problems by understanding, preparing, and analyzing data to predict emerging trends and to provide recommendations to optimize business results. They typically have academic training in a quantitative discipline such as statistics, operations research, machine learning, or econometrics, and combine use of data, analytics tools and languages with strong communication, visualization, and storytelling skills. (Open CDS L3).
f1ddddec-040b-4d53-98bb-f47bd197897c.name: Professional Certification: Level 3 - Distinguished Data Scientist

badge_template_activities.title: Distinguished Data Scientists achieve Certification by successfully completing three interviews by other Level 3 Certified Data Scientists, based upon a comprehensive package of information describing project and other experiences.  The criteria used to decide on certification include all of the Skills mentioned above at a "deep" level, having mastered the state of the art, as well as repeated experience successfully directing significantly complex Data Science initiatives.
Prior Certification at Level 2 - Master Certified Data Scientist is mandatory.

Distinguished Data Scientists have repeated experience successfully directing projects that significantly, positively, and measurably affect the business, as well as repeated experience in setting and driving Data Science goals and objectives for significant strategic initiatives.

Distinguished Data Scientists have experience in establishing the Data Science vision for significantly complex projects, and are able to lead with impact, successfully introducing innovations by re- imagining existing problems through the application of new Data Science capabilities.

Distinguished Data Scientists have demonstrated measurable, positive, significant impact on the business outcome through significantly complex projects or initiatives. This must have been demonstrated through financial or other KPIs.

Distinguished Data Scientists encourage the implementation and reuse of assets across project domains and can demonstrate their contribution to establishing the environment which supports the creation of reusable assets.

Distinguished Data Scientists continually develop and maintain their knowledge of the technology trends that are relevant to developing solutions for solving business problems, so that they are able to leverage that body of knowledge into feasible solutions.
Distinguished Data Scientists continually develop and maintain an understanding of their clients' businesses as it pertains to their clients' vertical industries (e.g., telecoms, financial, etc.).
Distinguished Data Scientists continually develop their skills and knowledge of the latest data science-related trends and techniques.

Distinguished Data Scientists are required to make contributions to the Data Scientist Profession by, for example, publications, teaching, contributions to open source, research collaboration, or participation in professional organizations.
Distinguished Data Scientists are expected to contribute to the growth of the community of professional Data Scientists through teaching, serving on peer review boards, coaching, and/or mentoring.

Applicants must previously have been Certified at Level 2 - Master Certified Data Scientist, and must have a valid Level 3 Professional Development Milestone Badge and three valid Level 3 Experience Profile Milestone badges.  See document X1821 in The Open Group library for more details.

0cc90c6d-d840-48c1-ba29-7f9d500cd32d.description: The badge earner has a basic understanding of the delivery of value in a digital enterprise having acquired basic knowledge of Enterprise Architecture based on the TOGAF Standard, and the Digital Practitioner Body of Knowledge™ Standard.
0cc90c6d-d840-48c1-ba29-7f9d500cd32d.name: The Open Group: TOGAF® Digital Enterprise Architecture Team Member 9.2

alignments.name: The TOGAF® Standard, Version 9.2 (Doc. No. C182)
alignments.description: The TOGAF® Standard, a standard of The Open Group, is a proven Enterprise Architecture methodology and framework used by the world's leading organizations to improve business efficiency.

alignments.name: The Digital Practitioner Body of Knowledge Standard (Doc. No. C196)
alignments.description: This document is intended to assist individuals and organizations who wish to create and manage product offerings with an increasing digital component, or lead their organization through Digital Transformation.

badge_template_activities.title: The Open Group Certified: TOGAF® 9 Foundation
The badge earner has up-to-date knowledge of the TOGAF Standard, Version 9.2, having earned the prerequisite TOGAF 9 Foundation badge on or after November 1, 2019.
The Open Group Certified: DPBoK™ Foundation

1e80fe2e-2d5e-41ad-9d41-8d870ffd6680.description: Badge earners have knowledge and understanding to contribute within organizations applying the TOGAF Standard. Individuals have the following competencies: 1) A common language with TOGAF practitioners. 2) A basic understanding of the TOGAF approach for Enterprise Architecture. 3) The prerequisite qualification for becoming a TOGAF® Enterprise Architecture Practitioner.
1e80fe2e-2d5e-41ad-9d41-8d870ffd6680.name: The Open Group Certified: TOGAF® Enterprise Architecture Foundation

alignments.name: The TOGAF® Standard, 10th Edition
alignments.description: The TOGAF® Standard, 10th Edition makes adoption of best practices easier. It will show you where to find enduring and universal concepts and proven best practice and it will also underscore where to look for new emerging ideas.

badge_template_activities.title: Certification is open to all applicants – there is no requirement for any previous certification.

To achieve certification to the TOGAF Enterprise Architecture Foundation Body of Knowledge, Candidates must complete the Level 1 Learning Units defined in Section 3.1 of the TOGAF® Certification Program Conformance Requirements (Multi-Level), Version 4.0 document and pass the TOGAF Enterprise Architecture Part 1 examination.
The TOGAF Enterprise Architecture Part 1 examination is the assessment for the TOGAF Enterprise Architecture Foundation certification.
The duration of certification is indefinite – certification is to a given version of the Body of Knowledge and does not expire, so there are no re-certification or renewal requirements.

57fc7b28-1502-46ca-8b1d-d8476a5cc0d3.description: The badge earner has demonstrated their ability as an Applied TOGAF® Enterprise Architecture Practitioner.
57fc7b28-1502-46ca-8b1d-d8476a5cc0d3.name: The Open Group Certified: Applied TOGAF® Enterprise Architecture Practitioner

badge_template_activities.title: The earner has earned the TOGAF Enterprise Architecture Practitioner certification badge.

The earner has successfully completed the TOGAF Enterprise Architecture Practitioner Learning Studies as part of an accredited TOGAF Enterprise Architecture training course under the supervision of an authorized trainer.
The register of accredited TOGAF Enterprise Architecture training courses.

89977c68-fd19-4505-8301-20b9ce6baafa.description: Master Certified Technical Specialists in Data Management have expertise in one or more relational and non-relational data management-based software product areas. Examples include mainstream data management software products, such as those from IBM and Oracle. Typical examples of the deliverables are building proof-of-concept solutions with data management technology, and architecting data management solutions to address client requirements. (Open CTS DM L2)
89977c68-fd19-4505-8301-20b9ce6baafa.name: Professional Certification: Master Certified Technical Specialist, Data Management

badge_template_activities.title: Master Certified Technical Specialists achieve Certification by successfully completing three interviews by other Level 2 or Level 3 Certified Technical Specialists, based upon a comprehensive package of information describing project and other experiences.  The criteria used to decide on certification include all of the Skills mentioned above, as well as the requirements for repeated leadership of successful project engagements.

Master Certified Technical Specialitsts typically have eight (8) years of work experience in IT in the last 12 years, that includes the understanding and appreciation of the solution lifecycle from strategy, design, and implementation through to completion, enabling them to produce solution designs that are successful.

Master Certified Technical Specialists have sufficient experience in their chosen Stream/Discipline to demonstrate repeated success in meeting the Stream-specific criteria. Typically, this requires three (3) years of work experience in their Stream/Discipline in the last five (5) years and five (5) years of experience in projects involving two or more Streams/Disciplines in the last eight (8) years.

Master Certified Technical Specialists must have acted in a leadership role in at least three (3) engagements. At least two of the three engagements must have been in connection with projects that met their acceptance criteria.
Master Certified Technical Specialists must have completed formal training in Project Management either through attendance at a taught course, or through self-study.

Master Certified Technical Specialists must maintain their knowledge of the technology, trends, and techniques in the IT industry, and must undergo 40 hours per year of training, at a taught course or through self study, related to their Stream/Discipline.

Master Certified Technical Specialists must make contributions to the profession through, for example, mentoring, publications, teaching, research collaboration, or participation in professional organizations.
Certification is open to all applicants.  There is no requirement for any previous certification.

They have been assessed to ensure they have the skills to effectively communicate the information to candidates.
240af5ca-16f1-4c0a-8bb5-d5155705bb97.name: The Open Group: Authorized TOGAF® Trainer 9.2

alignments.name: The Open Group Certification for People: Training Course Accreditation Requirements
alignments.description: Section 3.2 of The Open Group Certification for People: Training Course Accreditation Requirements documents the Trainer Requirements.

badge_template_activities.title: Badge holders are appropriately qualified, skilled in teaching, have knowledge of and experience in the subject area, are familiar with the Body of Knowledge, and keep themselves up-to-date in line with changes to the Body of Knowledge.
The Open Group Certified: TOGAF® 9 Certified
Badge holders must have one of the following:

— A relevant training qualification that has recognition in the geography in which it was obtained (two examples are: certification from the Institute of IT Training, and The Open Group Certified Technical Specialist (Open CTS) Certification with Technical Training as the Client Focus Area)
— A minimum of one (1) year of relevant training experience
— Completed a train the trainer program that meets the criteria documented in Section 3.2 of The Open Group Certification for People: Training Course Accreditation Requirements

Trainer approval is part of the Training Course Accreditation scope. In advance of a trainer delivering an Accredited Training Course, the Accredited Training Course provider must obtain the Certification Authority’s approval for the trainer by providing the trainer’s credentials as evidence that these requirements are met, including the trainer’s name, contact details, training qualifications, and certification status.
Badges remain valid while the badge holder is an authorized trainer associated with an applicable training course accredited by The Open Group. Once that is no longer true, the badge is revoked.

Typical deliverables include asset classification models, risk analyses, security policies, security solution scenarios, implementation plans, security services, organization models, procedures, security effectiveness evaluation, security awareness workshops, and security incident management plans. badge_template_activities.title: Certified Technical Specialists achieve Certification by successfully completing interviews with other Level 2 or Level 3 Certified Technical Specialists, based upon a comprehensive package of information describing project and other experiences. Certified Technical Specialitsts typically, have five (5) years of work experience in IT in the last eight (8) years (excluding time spent under tuition), that includes an understanding of the solution lifecycle, enabling them to contribute to solutions that are successful.

Certified Technical Specialists have sufficient experience in their chosen Stream to demonstrate repeated success in meeting the Stream specific criteria.  Typically, this requires three (3) years of work experience in their Stream in the last five (5) years.

Certified Technical Specialists have acted in the role of IT Specialist within their Stream in at least two (2) successful engagements, and the deliverables they produced must have contributed to the engagement meeting its acceptance criteria.
Certified Technical Specialists must have completed formal training in Project Management either through attendance at a taught course, or through self-study.

Certified Technical Specialists must maintain their knowledge of the technology, trends, and techniques in the IT industry, and must undergo 40 hours per year of training, at a taught course or through self study, related to their Stream/Discipline.
Certification is open to all applicants.  There is no requirement for any previous certification.

483352e7-6c97-4f68-8ea5-29746b8e185a.description: Professional Architects need to be able to effectively communicate their topics verbally and in writing – topics that are critical for the continuation of their work, such as architectural decisions and design decisions. 483352e7-6c97-4f68-8ea5-29746b8e185a.name: Professional Certification: Level 1 Architect - Professional Communication Milestone

Professional Architects exhibit good verbal communication, with responsiveness to questions, ability to stay on subject, use of good feedback, and follow-up questions, etc., leading to effective two-way communication. This milestone badge is open to all applicants.  There is no requirement for any previous qualification.

Architects must have experience successfully directing a significantly complex architecture initiative, developing a solution typically involving different stakeholders, multiple lines of business, many solution varieties, highly regulated environments, (de)mergers, acquisitions, business transformations, international and/or global scale, etc.
Architects must have experience successfully directing a project and developing a solution that resulted in significant positive and measurable business value and/or impact.
Architects must have experience in setting and driving architecture goals and objectives for a significant strategic enterprise initiative.
