alignments.name: The ArchiMate® 3.1 Specification (Doc. No. C197)
alignments.description: The ArchiMate® Specification, a standard of The Open Group, defines an open and independent modeling language for Enterprise Architecture. The ArchiMate language enables Enterprise Architects to describe, analyze, and visualize the relationships among business domains in an unambiguous way.

alignments.name: The Open Group Certification for People: Training Course Accreditation Requirements
alignments.description: Section 3.2 of The Open Group Certification for People: Training Course Accreditation Requirements documents the Trainer Requirements.

badge_template_activities.title: Badge holders are appropriately qualified, skilled in teaching, have knowledge of and experience in the subject area, are familiar with the Body of Knowledge, and keep themselves up-to-date in line with changes to the Body of Knowledge.
The Open Group Certified: ArchiMate® 3 Practitioner
The Open Group Certified: ArchiMate® Essentials 3.1
Badge holders must have one of the following:

— A relevant training qualification that has recognition in the geography in which it was obtained (two examples are: certification from the Institute of IT Training, and The Open Group Certified Technical Specialist (Open CTS) Certification with Technical Training as the Client Focus Area)
— A minimum of one (1) year of relevant training experience
— Completed a train the trainer program that meets the criteria documented in Section 3.2 of The Open Group Certification for People: Training Course Accreditation Requirements

Trainer approval is part of the Training Course Accreditation scope. In advance of a trainer delivering an Accredited Training Course, the Accredited Training Course provider must obtain the Certification Authority’s approval for the trainer by providing the trainer’s credentials as evidence that these requirements are met, including the trainer’s name, contact details, training qualifications, and certification status.
Badges remain valid while the badge holder is an authorized trainer associated with an applicable training course accredited by The Open Group. Once that is no longer true, the badge is revoked.

ca5bc1c0-54e2-4285-aacb-056039b50fa9.description: Enterprise Architects create formalized descriptions of the structure and operation of an enterprise to show how it can most effectively achieve its current and future objectives. They define frameworks, models, mechanisms, and structures so that the business, information and technology capabilities may evolve in a way that effectively supports the business strategy or intent, and they provide guidance and governance of projects and transition steps to the future state. (Open CA EA L2)
ca5bc1c0-54e2-4285-aacb-056039b50fa9.name: Professional Certification: Level 2 - Master Certified Enterprise Architect

badge_template_activities.title: Master Certified Enterprise Architects achieve Certification by successfully completing three interviews by other Level 2 or Level 3 Certified Architects, based upon a comprehensive package of information describing project and other experiences.  The criteria used to decide on certification include all of the Skills mentioned above.  At Level 2, Architects must be able to demonstrate these skills at a "deep" level, having mastered the state of the art.

Master Certified Enterprise Architects must have at least 3 years of  Architecture work experience in one or more projects or engagements in which they were accountable for the  Architecture aspects and must have performed in the role of Lead Architect on successful architectural engagements/projects that met their acceptance criteria.

Master Certified Enterprise Architects have a variety of experiences that demonstrate their contribution to successful solutions to complex problems covering e.g., people, process, technology, and management, and involving at least four dimensions (products, technologies, services, processes, management, security, governance, etc.) and/or domains (Business, Data, Information, Application, Technology, Security, Integration, etc.)
Master Certified Enterprise Architects have experience producing solutions that involve more than one type of technology and more than one type of architecture.

A Master Certified Enterprise Architect's experience must include the solution lifecycle from strategy, design, and implementation through to completion, enabling the Architect to produce solution designs that are successful.

Master Certified Enterprise Architects must have completed formal training in the discipline of architecture (i.e., methods/frameworks for designing and defining enterprise architectures), either through attendance at a taught course, or through self-study, and are expected to continue to develop their skills and to stay up-to-date with the development of their profession.

Master Certified Enterprise Architects must continually develop their technical and professional knowledge and skills in technology trends, vertical industry sectors, and architecture trends and techniques.

Master Certified Architects must make contributions to the architecture profession; for example, architecture-related publications, research collaboration, development of training, or contributions to standards bodies or professional organizations.  They must also contribute to the development of professional architects through teaching, serving on certification boards, coaching, and/or mentoring.

Until June 1 2020 Certification is open to all applicants and there is no requirement for any previous certification.  From November 18 2019 we are introducing certification by Milestones in which Candidates must alreday hold valid Open CA Level 2 Professional Communication and  Professional Development Milestone Badges plus  three Level 2 Experience Profile Milestone Badges, at least two of which must be in Enterprise Architecture

bebf0a0f-ec67-4d50-aa32-687045475253.description: Certified Technical Specialists in Data Engineering have expertise in making available, integrating, and optimizing structured and/or unstructured data using data integration products, enterprise search and visualization technologies, and methods. Open CTS DE L1
bebf0a0f-ec67-4d50-aa32-687045475253.name: Professional Certification: Certified Technical Specialist, Data Engineering

badge_template_activities.title: Certified Technical Specialists achieve Certification by successfully completing an interview with a Level 2 or Level 3 Certified Technical Specialist, based upon a comprehensive package of information describing project and other experiences. The criteria used to decide on certification include all of the Skills mentioned above.  At Level 1, Technical Specialists must be able to demonstrate these skills at an "applied" level, perhaps with support and mentoring.
Certified Technical Specialists have had at least 24 months of Full Time Equivalent experience, possibly with support or mentoring.

Certified Technical Specialists have participated as a Technical Specialist in at least two successful solutions/engagements in which their artifacts were used or could have been used in the implementation of the solution/component.
Certified Technical Specialists  have worked with at least two types of technology, technique or architecture
Certified Technical Specialists must have completed formal training in Project Management either through attendance at a taught course, or through self-study.

Certified Technical Specialists must maintain their knowledge of the technology, trends, and techniques in the IT industry, and must undergo 40 hours per year of training, at a taught course or through self study, related to their Stream/Discipline.

Candidates must already hold valid Open CTS Level 1 (or 2) Professional Communication and  Professional Development Milestone Badges plus two Experience Profile Milestone Badges, at least one of which must be in this Specialty

59e40113-8974-47fd-adb7-18d4d821c0ee.description: Certified Technical Specialists in Network Systems have expertise in one or more networking system technology areas. Examples include routers, networking controllers, bridges, or networking software related to these technologies. Open CTS NS L1

971ddaa5-e02f-46df-a84c-8b7caf23ed1e.description: Certified Technical Specialists in the Portal and Collaboration stream have expertise in one or more areas of mainstream portal and collaboration software. Typical deliverables areÊ proof-of-concept solutions, architecting portal and collaboration software solutions to address client requirements, andÊ solution assurance reviews to ensure that proposed solutions meet client requirements. (Open CTS PC L1)
971ddaa5-e02f-46df-a84c-8b7caf23ed1e.name: Professional Certification: Certified Technical Specialist, Portal & Collaboration

badge_template_activities.title: Certified Technical Specialists achieve Certification by successfully completing interviews with other Level 2 or Level 3 Certified Technical Specialists, based upon a comprehensive package of information describing project and other experiences. The criteria used to decide on certification include all of the Skills mentioned above.

Certified Technical Specialitsts typically, have five (5) years of work experience in IT in the last eight (8) years (excluding time spent under tuition), that includes an understanding of the solution lifecycle, enabling them to contribute to solutions that are successful.

Certified Technical Specialists have sufficient experience in their chosen Stream to demonstrate repeated success in meeting the Stream specific criteria.  Typically, this requires three (3) years of work experience in their Stream in the last five (5) years.

Certified Technical Specialists have acted in the role of IT Specialist within their Stream in at least two (2) successful engagements, and the deliverables they produced must have contributed to the engagement meeting its acceptance criteria.
Certified Technical Specialists must have completed formal training in Project Management either through attendance at a taught course, or through self-study.

Certified Technical Specialists must maintain their knowledge of the technology, trends, and techniques in the IT industry, and must undergo 40 hours per year of training, at a taught course or through self study, related to their Stream/Discipline.
Certification is open to all applicants.  There is no requirement for any previous certification.

8fbd6897-3604-467c-a909-fd03051fd322.description: Solution Architects create formalized descriptions of solutions to business problems and opportunities developed through the reasoned application of technologies, people, and processes to successfully deliver systems and capabilities that support the needs of the business. Typical job titles within this discipline include IT Architect, System Architect, Delivery Architect, Security Architect, and Infrastructure Architect. (Open CA EXP SA L1)
8fbd6897-3604-467c-a909-fd03051fd322.name: Professional Certification: Level 1 Solution Architect - Experience Profile Milestone

badge_template_activities.title: Architects achieve this Milestone by submitting a comprehensive package of information describing project and other experiences for review by an experienced Architect.  The assessment criteria include all of the Skills mentioned above.  At Level 1, Architects must be able to demonstrate these skills at an "applied" level, perhaps with support and mentoring.
Solution Architects must have participated in the role of Architect on a successful architectural engagement or project.
Solution Architects must have participated in the role of Architect on a complex architectural engagement or project.
This milestone badge is open to all applicants.  There is no requirement for any previous credential or certification.

7b2ddec6-05cf-4954-bfcf-b8bc1f7e91ef.description: Master Certified Technical Specialists in the Data Integration stream have expertise in making available, integrating, and optimizing structured and/or unstructured data using database products, technologies, and methods. Typical examples of the deliverables are database designs, information models (logical, physical, dimensional, etc.), data migration plans, and data warehouses. (Open CTS DI L2)
7b2ddec6-05cf-4954-bfcf-b8bc1f7e91ef.name: Professional Certification: Master Certified Technical Specialist, Data Integration

badge_template_activities.title: Master Certified Technical Specialists achieve Certification by successfully completing three interviews by other Level 2 or Level 3 Certified Technical Specialists, based upon a comprehensive package of information describing project and other experiences.  The criteria used to decide on certification include all of the Skills mentioned above, as well as the requirements for repeated leadership of successful project engagements.

Master Certified Technical Specialitsts typically have eight (8) years of work experience in IT in the last 12 years, that includes the understanding and appreciation of the solution lifecycle from strategy, design, and implementation through to completion, enabling them to produce solution designs that are successful.

Master Certified Technical Specialists have sufficient experience in their chosen Stream/Discipline to demonstrate repeated success in meeting the Stream-specific criteria. Typically, this requires three (3) years of work experience in their Stream/Discipline in the last five (5) years and five (5) years of experience in projects involving two or more Streams/Disciplines in the last eight (8) years.

Master Certified Technical Specialists must have acted in a leadership role in at least three (3) engagements. At least two of the three engagements must have been in connection with projects that met their acceptance criteria.
Master Certified Technical Specialists must have completed formal training in Project Management either through attendance at a taught course, or through self-study.

Master Certified Technical Specialists must maintain their knowledge of the technology, trends, and techniques in the IT industry, and must undergo 40 hours per year of training, at a taught course or through self study, related to their Stream/Discipline.

Master Certified Technical Specialists must make contributions to the profession through, for example, mentoring, publications, teaching, research collaboration, or participation in professional organizations.
Certification is open to all applicants.  There is no requirement for any previous certification.

c5ab7638-34fa-40d9-aeee-6bf00be9f3b3.description: Certified Technical Specialists in this Stream have expertise in one or more application development products. Examples include mainstream application development frameworks, such as from IBM, Microsoft, and Oracle. Typical deliverables are proof-of-concept solutions with application development technology, architecting application development software solutions to address client requirements, and conducting solution assurance reviews to ensure client requirements are met. (Open CTS ADP L1)
c5ab7638-34fa-40d9-aeee-6bf00be9f3b3.name: Professional Certification: Certified Technical Specialist, Application Development Products

14a22a7d-737d-4cbe-b3d8-b336d4b02dbc.description: Badge earners have knowledge and understanding of how to adapt and use the TOGAF framework to support an Agile enterprise. Key competencies include applying the TOGAF framework to support iterative development and Agile delivery, Agile Enterprise Architecture governance, Agile Product Management techniques, and using sprints with the TOGAF ADM.
14a22a7d-737d-4cbe-b3d8-b336d4b02dbc.name: The Open Group Certified: TOGAF® Framework Agile Specialist

Applicants are required to hold a TOGAF certification at the Foundation level or higher.
The path to achieve this certification credential is to complete the Learning Units defined in the Conformance Requirements document and a pass result for the assessment.

(Open CTS PD L3)
31eb18af-c7ec-4ff1-962a-63d56f3a8dd9.name: Professional Certification: Level 3 Technical Specialist - Professional Development Milestone

badge_template_activities.title: At Level 3, Technical Specialists must continually develop their technical and professional knowledge and skills in technology trends and techniques in the IT industry, and in leadership skills, as well as developing and enhancing their knowledge and understanding of the business and industry context of their employers/clients.

They are required to make contributions to the profession, such as publications, research, development of training, or contributions to standards bodies or professional organizations that seek to define innovative new technical solutions, strategies, research, or technologies.  They must also facilitate the professional development of multiple aspiring Technical Specialists, especially those seeking certification, through teaching, coaching, and/or mentoring.
Candidates must already have achieved Open CTS Level 2 Certification before applying for this Badge

alignments.description: Section 3.2 of The Open Group Certification for People: Training Course Accreditation Requirements documents the Trainer Requirements.

badge_template_activities.title: Badge holders are appropriately qualified, skilled in teaching, have knowledge of and experience in the subject area, are familiar with the Body of Knowledge, and keep themselves up-to-date in line with changes to the Body of Knowledge.
The Open Group Certified: TOGAF® Enterprise Architecture Practitioner
The Open Group Certified: Applied TOGAF® Enterprise Architecture Practitioner
Badge holders must have one of the following:

— A relevant training qualification that has recognition in the geography in which it was obtained (two examples are: certification from the Institute of IT Training, and The Open Group Certified Technical Specialist (Open CTS) Certification with Technical Training as the Client Focus Area)
— A minimum of one (1) year of relevant training experience
— Completed a train the trainer program that meets the criteria documented in Section 3.2 of The Open Group Certification for People: Training Course Accreditation Requirements

Trainer approval is part of the Training Course Accreditation scope. In advance of a trainer delivering an Accredited Training Course, the Accredited Training Course provider must obtain the Certification Authority’s approval for the trainer by providing the trainer’s credentials as evidence that these requirements are met, including the trainer’s name, contact details, training qualifications, and certification status.
Badges remain valid while the badge holder is an authorized trainer associated with an applicable training course accredited by The Open Group. Once that is no longer true, the badge is revoked.

337c4108-d501-4b21-80b2-9a3f51684276.description: Badge earners have knowledge and understanding of how to apply Enterprise Architecture and the TOGAF Standard to support the Digital enterprise. 93826292-d06e-4a4e-86a0-e809d628ddf1.description: Master Certified Technical Specialists in Business Information Management have expertise in making available, integrating, and optimizing structured and/or unstructured data in order to present or distribute information for use and analysis by the business. Specialties are Business Intelligence and Content Integration. Typical examples of deliverables are strategy maps, information models (logical, physical, dimensional, etc.), data warehouses, balanced scorecards, and reports. (Open CTS BI L2)
93826292-d06e-4a4e-86a0-e809d628ddf1.name: Professional Certification: Master Certified Technical Specialist, Business Information Management

9c2e26a8-1ac3-45ef-88be-671e7f077536.description: Business Architects create formalized descriptions of how an organization uses its essential competencies for realizing its strategic intent and objectives, as defined in the Open Business Architecture (O-BA) Preliminary Standard. This typically describes the structure and interaction between business strategy, organization, functions, business capabilities, and information needs. Business Architects capture strategic intent and develop the Business Architecture. (Open CA EXP BA L2)
9c2e26a8-1ac3-45ef-88be-671e7f077536.name: Professional Certification: Level 2 Business Architect - Experience Profile Milestone

badge_template_activities.title: Business Architects achieve this Milestone by submitting a comprehensive package of information describing project and other experiences for review by a Master Certified Architect.  The assessment criteria include all of the Skills mentioned above.  At Level 2, Architects must be able to demonstrate these skills at a "deep" level, having mastered the state of the art.
Business Architects must have performed in the role of lead Architect on a successful architectural engagement or project that met its acceptance criteria.
Business Architects must have performed as a lead Architect in the development of a major project or subsystem.
Business Architects must have performed as a lead Architect on a complex architectural engagement or project.
This milestone badge is open to all applicants.  There is no requirement for any previous qualification.

206fbf0e-c310-4c4e-90a7-6143021bb51e.description: Professional Data Scientists work with business leaders to solve problems by understanding, preparing, and analyzing data to predict emerging trends and to provide recommendations to optimize business results. They typically have academic training in a quantitative discipline such as statistics, operations research, machine learning, or econometrics, and combine use of data, analytics tools and languages with strong communication, visualization, and storytelling skills. (Open CDS EXP L2).
206fbf0e-c310-4c4e-90a7-6143021bb51e.name: Professional Certification: Level 2 Data Scientist - Experience Profile Milestone

badge_template_activities.title: Data Scientists achieve this Milestone by submitting a comprehensive package of information describing project and other experiences for review by an experienced Data Scientist.  The assessment criteria include all of the Skills mentioned above.  At Level 2, Data Scientists must be able to demonstrate these skills at a "deep" level, having mastered the state of the art.

Candidates must have acted in the role of Data Scientist on a Data Science engagement or project that met its acceptance criteria.  Meeting acceptance criteria means that a validated model that solved the problem was accepted or adopted by the business.
Candidates must have performed as a lead Data Scientist in the development of a major project or subsystem.
This milestone badge is open to all applicants.  There is no requirement for any previous qualification.

2160ae5a-abce-43f1-a81f-ee7c35cba139.description: Professional Data Scientists need to be able to effectively communicate data science topics verbally and in writing – topics that are critical for the continuation of their work. (Open CDS PC L2)
2160ae5a-abce-43f1-a81f-ee7c35cba139.name: Professional Certification: Level 2 Data Scientist - Professional Communication Milestone

badge_template_activities.title: Professional Data Scientists exhibit good written communication of data science related topics, including the use of proper grammar, spelling, document organization, clarity, and use of appropriate content for the audience to meet its purpose.

Professional Data Scientists exhibit good verbal communication, with responsiveness to questions, ability to stay on subject, use of good feedback, and follow-up questions, etc., leading to effective two-way communication. Culturally-appropriate body language is expected in face-to-face meetings and video teleconferencing.
This milestone badge is open to all applicants.  There is no requirement for any previous qualification.

19a6097c-5b68-4614-b86b-c426af3d24bc.description: vAt Level 2, Technical Specialists are required to have undergone training in Project Management and in their Specialty, to regularly develop their professional knowledge and skills and to make contributions to the development of their Profession. (Open CTS PD L2)
19a6097c-5b68-4614-b86b-c426af3d24bc.name: Professional Certification: Level 2 Technical Specialist - Professional Development Milestone

c6915988-80e6-4b2b-a3ed-768c65afa545.name: Professional Certification: Level 2 Data Scientist - Professional Development Milestone

badge_template_activities.title: Professional Data Scientists must have completed formal training in the discipline of Data Science such as statistics, operations research, machine learning, or econometrics, either through attendance at a taught course, or through self-study.
Professional Data Scientists are required to maintain their knowledge of the technology, trends, and techniques that are relevant to developing solutions for solving business problems.
Professional Data Scientists are required to maintain an understanding of their client’s business as it pertains to their client’s vertical industry (e.g., telecoms, financial, etc.).
Professional Data Scientists must have demonstrated experience of using reusable assets created by others or of providing assets for reuse. Five examples are required.

Professional Data Scientists must make contributions to the Data Scientist profession by mentoring and, for example, publications, teaching, research collaboration, or participation in professional organizations.
This milestone badge is open to all applicants.  There is no requirement for any previous qualification.

alignments.description: Section 3.2 of The Open Group Certification for People: Training Course Accreditation Requirements documents the Trainer Requirements.

badge_template_activities.title: Badge holders are appropriately qualified, skilled in teaching, have knowledge of and experience in the subject area, are familiar with the Body of Knowledge, and keep themselves up-to-date in line with changes to the Body of Knowledge.
The Open Group Certified: TOGAF® 9 Certified
The Open Group Certified: TOGAF® Business Architecture Level 1
Badge holders must have one of the following:

— A relevant training qualification that has recognition in the geography in which it was obtained (two examples are: certification from the Institute of IT Training, and The Open Group Certified Technical Specialist (Open CTS) Certification with Technical Training as the Client Focus Area)
— A minimum of one (1) year of relevant training experience
— Completed a train the trainer program that meets the criteria documented in Section 3.2 of The Open Group Certification for People: Training Course Accreditation Requirements

Trainer approval is part of the Training Course Accreditation scope. In advance of a trainer delivering an Accredited Training Course, the Accredited Training Course provider must obtain the Certification Authority’s approval for the trainer by providing the trainer’s credentials as evidence that these requirements are met, including the trainer’s name, contact details, training qualifications, and certification status.
Badges remain valid while the badge holder is an authorized trainer associated with an applicable training course accredited by The Open Group. Once that is no longer true, the badge is revoked.

c405182d-d2bc-4489-a8b9-2a555c741878.description: Certified Technical Specialists in Business Information Management have expertise in making available, integrating, and optimizing structured and/or unstructured data in order to present or distribute information for use and analysis by the business. Specialties are Business Intelligence and Content Integration. Typical examples of the deliverables are strategy maps, information models (logical, physical, dimensional, etc.), data warehouses, balanced scorecards, and reports. (Open CTS BI L1)
c405182d-d2bc-4489-a8b9-2a555c741878.name: Professional Certification: Certified Technical Specialist, Business Information Management

badge_template_activities.title: Certified Technical Specialists achieve Certification by successfully completing interviews with other Level 2 or Level 3 Certified Technical Specialists, based upon a comprehensive package of information describing project and other experiences. The criteria used to decide on certification include all of the Skills mentioned above.

Certified Technical Specialitsts typically, have five (5) years of work experience in IT in the last eight (8) years (excluding time spent under tuition), that includes an understanding of the solution lifecycle, enabling them to contribute to solutions that are successful.

Certified Technical Specialists have sufficient experience in their chosen Stream to demonstrate repeated success in meeting the Stream specific criteria.  Typically, this requires three (3) years of work experience in their Stream in the last five (5) years.

Certified Technical Specialists have acted in the role of IT Specialist within their Stream in at least two (2) successful engagements, and the deliverables they produced must have contributed to the engagement meeting its acceptance criteria.
Certified Technical Specialists must have completed formal training in Project Management either through attendance at a taught course, or through self-study.

Certified Technical Specialists must maintain their knowledge of the technology, trends, and techniques in the IT industry, and must undergo 40 hours per year of training, at a taught course or through self study, related to their Stream/Discipline.
Certification is open to all applicants.  There is no requirement for any previous certification.

ad5ae070-db60-4ecc-80fc-a08e7e83c3d1.description: Certified Technical Specialists in the Data Integration stream have expertise in making available, integrating, and optimizing structured and/or unstructured data using database products, technologies, and methods. Typical examples of the deliverables are database designs, information models (logical, physical, dimensional, etc.), data migration plans, and data warehouses. (Open CTS DI L1)
ad5ae070-db60-4ecc-80fc-a08e7e83c3d1.name: Professional Certification: Certified Technical Specialist, Data Integration

badge_template_activities.title: Certified Technical Specialists achieve Certification by successfully completing interviews with other Level 2 or Level 3 Certified Technical Specialists, based upon a comprehensive package of information describing project and other experiences. The criteria used to decide on certification include all of the Skills mentioned above.

Certified Technical Specialitsts typically, have five (5) years of work experience in IT in the last eight (8) years (excluding time spent under tuition), that includes an understanding of the solution lifecycle, enabling them to contribute to solutions that are successful.

Certified Technical Specialists have sufficient experience in their chosen Stream to demonstrate repeated success in meeting the Stream specific criteria.  Typically, this requires three (3) years of work experience in their Stream in the last five (5) years.

Certified Technical Specialists have acted in the role of IT Specialist within their Stream in at least two (2) successful engagements, and the deliverables they produced must have contributed to the engagement meeting its acceptance criteria.
Certified Technical Specialists must have completed formal training in Project Management either through attendance at a taught course, or through self-study.

Certified Technical Specialists must maintain their knowledge of the technology, trends, and techniques in the IT industry, and must undergo 40 hours per year of training, at a taught course or through self study, related to their Stream/Discipline.
Certification is open to all applicants.  There is no requirement for any previous certification.

a6d62ed6-5008-41fd-90a4-c2ee7af6b627.description: Professional Data Scientists need to be able to effectively communicate data science topics verbally and in writing – topics that are critical for the continuation of their work. At Level 1, support and mentoring is allowed. (Open CDS PC L1)
a6d62ed6-5008-41fd-90a4-c2ee7af6b627.name: Professional Certification: Level 1 Data Scientist - Professional Communication Milestone

badge_template_activities.title: Professional Data Scientists exhibit good written communication of data science related topics, including the use of proper grammar, spelling, document organization, clarity, and use of appropriate content for the audience to meet its purpose.

Professional Data Scientists exhibit good verbal communication, with responsiveness to questions, ability to stay on subject, use of good feedback, and follow-up questions, etc., leading to effective two-way communication. Culturally-appropriate body language is expected in face-to-face meetings and video teleconferencing.
This milestone badge is open to all applicants.  There is no requirement for any previous qualification.

cfc42338-b4a8-40e2-b069-34f32f7469ed.description: Professional Data Scientists are required to have undergone training in data science methods and to regularly develop their professional knowledge and skills. They are also required to have made contributions to the Data Science profession. (Open CDS PD L1)
cfc42338-b4a8-40e2-b069-34f32f7469ed.name: Professional Certification: Level 1 Data Scientist - Professional Development Milestone

badge_template_activities.title: Professional Data Scientists must have completed formal training in the discipline of Data Science such as statistics, operations research, machine learning, or econometrics) either through attendance at a taught course, or through self-study, and are required to to continue to develop their skills and to stay up-to-date with the development of their profession.
Professional Data Scientists are required to develop and maintain their knowledge of the technology, trends, and techniques that are relevant to developing solutions for solving business problems.
Professional Data Scientists are required to develop and maintain an understanding of their client’s business as it pertains to their client’s vertical industry (e.g., telecoms, financial, etc.).
Professional Data Scientists must have demonstrated experience of using reusable assets created by others or of providing assets for reuse. Two or more examples are required.

Professional Data Scientists must have made contributions to the Data Science profession including mentoring and, for example, publications, teaching, research collaboration, or participation in professional organizations.
This milestone badge is open to all applicants.  There is no requirement for any previous qualification.

a198c717-c4e3-4f46-a691-ad03a63d20f5.description: Business Architects create formalized descriptions of how an organization uses its essential competencies for realizing its strategic intent and objectives, as defined in the Open Business Architecture (O-BA) Standard. This typically describes the structure and interaction between business strategy, organization, functions, business capabilities, and information needs. Business Architects capture strategic intent and develop the Business Architecture. (Open CA BA L2)
a198c717-c4e3-4f46-a691-ad03a63d20f5.name: Professional Certification: Level 2 - Master Certified Architect - Business

badge_template_activities.title: Master Certified  Architects achieve Certification by successfully completing three interviews by other Level 2 or Level 3 Certified Architects, based upon a comprehensive package of information describing project and other experiences.  The criteria used to decide on certification include all of the Skills mentioned above.  At Level 2, Architects must be able to demonstrate these skills at a "deep" level, having mastered the state of the art.

Master Certified  Architects must have at least 3 years of  Architecture work experience in one or more projects or engagements in which they were accountable for the Architecture aspects and must have performed in the role of Lead Architect on successful architectural engagements or projects that met their acceptance criteria.

Master Certified Architects have a variety of experiences that show their ability to deliver successful solutions to complex problems invloving strategy (e.g. business vision, business logic, ambition) and operational aspects (e.g. people, process, technology), and management, and involving at least four dimensions (products, technologies, services, processes, management, security, governance, etc) and/or domains (Business, Data, Information, Application, Technology, Security, Integration, etc.)

Master Certified Architects must have experience producing solutions/business-related change that involves more than one type of technology and/or architecture, to realize business capabilities for example in transport, manufacturing, or utilities.

A Master Certified Architect's experience must include the understanding and appreciation of the solution lifecycle from strategy, design, and implementation through to completion, enabling the Architect to produce solution designs that are successful.

Master Certified Architects must have completed formal training in the discipline of architecture (i.e., methods/frameworks for designing and defining business architectures), either through attendance at a taught course, or through self-study, and are expected to continue to develop their skills and to stay up-to-date with the development of their profession
Master Certified Architects must continually develop their technical and professional knowledge and skills in technology trends, vertical industry sectors, and architecture trends and techniques.

Master Certified Architects must make contributions to the architecture profession; for example, architecture-related publications, research collaboration, development of training, or contributions to standards bodies or professional organizations.  They must also contribute to the development of professional architects through teaching, serving on certification boards, coaching, and/or mentoring.

Until June 1 2020 Certification is open to all applicants and there is no requirement for any previous certification.  From November 18 2019 we are introducing certification by Milestones in which Candidates must alreday hold valid Open CA Level 2 Professional Communication and  Professional Development Milestone Badges plus three Level 2 Experience Profile Milestone Badges, at least two of which must be in Business Architecture

f75766f9-e655-424a-8fc5-5585877443b4.description: Badge holders have acquired the skills to teach the knowledge of the terminology, structure, basic concepts, and core principles of the IT4IT Reference Architecture and the IT Value Chain. They have been assessed to ensure they have the skills to effectively communicate the information to candidates.
f75766f9-e655-424a-8fc5-5585877443b4.name: The Open Group: Authorized IT4IT™ Trainer 2.1

alignments.description: The Open Group IT4IT Reference Architecture is a standard reference architecture and value chain-based operating model for managing the business of IT.

247bdc7b-10db-4a7b-bd24-11e7b8289b46.description: Digital Architects create the formalized description of digital solutions and roadmaps for enterprises to determine how they can undergo Digital Transformation to enable innovation to achieve their strategic goals. They support the synthesis of complex business, technology, and client issues into real-world strategies through the application of innovative approaches to solutions through development, procurement of services, and management of relationships with suppliers. (Open CA EXP DA L2)
247bdc7b-10db-4a7b-bd24-11e7b8289b46.name: Professional Certification: Level 2 Digital Architect - Experience Profile Milestone

badge_template_activities.title: Digital Architects achieve this Milestone by submitting a comprehensive package of information describing project and other experiences for review by a Master Certified Architect.  The assessment criteria include all of the Skills mentioned above.  At Level 2, Architects must be able to demonstrate these skills at a "deep" level, having mastered the state of the art.
Digtal Architects must have performed in the role of lead Architect on a successful architectural engagement or project that met its acceptance criteria.
Digital Architects must have performed as a lead Architect in the development of a major project or subsystem.
Digital Architects must have performed as a lead Architect on a complex architectural engagement or project.
This milestone badge is open to all applicants.  There is no requirement for any previous qualification.

23c9040b-7239-4fc6-b78c-417e98d497b8.description: Distinguished Data Scientists work with business leaders to solve problems by understanding, preparing, and analyzing data to predict emerging trends and to provide recommendations to optimize business results. They typically have academic training in a quantitative discipline such as statistics, operations research, machine learning, or econometrics, and combine use of data, analytics tools and languages with strong communication, visualization, and storytelling skills. (Open CDS L3).
23c9040b-7239-4fc6-b78c-417e98d497b8.name: Professional Certification: Level 3 Data Scientist - Experience Profile Milestone

badge_template_activities.title: Professional Data Scientists at Level 3 achieve this Milestone by submitting a comprehensive package of information describing project and other experiences for review by a Distinguished Data Scientist.  The assessment criteria include all of the Skills mentioned above.  At Level 3, Data Scientists must be able to demonstrate these skills at a "deep" level, having mastered the state of the art.

Professional Data Scientists at Level 3 have experience successfully directing a significantly complex Data Science initiative in which they can show experience with developing a solution that typically involved different stakeholders, numerous multiple data types, multiple data sources, multiple integration techniques, and that for which high accuracy is critical.
Professional Data Scientists at Level 3 have experience successfully directing a project that significantly, positively, and measurably affected the business of their clients.

Professional Data Scientists at Level 3 have experience in setting and driving Data Science goals and objectives for significant strategic initiatives, providing thought leadership towards directing and delivering the mission of the organization.

Applicants are strongly advised to have been Certified at Level 2, Master Certified Data Scientist, before applying for this Milestone Badge.  See document X1821 in The Open Group Library for more information.

716f21ae-7031-4846-8a65-97fe10d67193.description: Enterprise Architects create formalized descriptions of the structure and operation of an enterprise to show how it can most effectively achieve its current and future objectives. They define frameworks, models, mechanisms, and structures so that the business, information and technology capabilities may evolve in a way that effectively supports the business strategy or intent, and they provide guidance and governance of projects and transition steps to the future state. (Open CA EA L1)
716f21ae-7031-4846-8a65-97fe10d67193.name: Professional Certification: Level 1 - Certified Enterprise Architect

badge_template_activities.title: Certified Enterprise Architects achieve Certification by successfully completing an interview by a Level 2 or Level 3 Certified Architect, based upon a comprehensive package of information describing project and other experiences.  The criteria used to decide on certification include all of the Skills mentioned above. At Level 1, Architects must be able to demonstrate these skills at an "applied" level, perhaps with support and mentoring.

Certified Enterprise Architects must have at least 2 years of experience of contributing to the development of the architectural aspects of one or more  projects or engagements, possibly with support or mentoring, and must have participated in the role of Architect in two successful, complex architectural engagements or projects

Certified Enterprise Architects have a variety of experiences that demonstrate their contribution to successful solutions to complex problems covering e.g., people, process, technology, and management, and involving more than one dimension (products, technologies, services, processes, management, security, governance, etc.) and/or domain (Business, Data, Information, Application, Technology, Security, Integration, etc.)
Certified Enterprise Architects have experience producing solutions that involve more than one type of technology and/or architecture.
Certified Enterprise Architects must have demonstrated their appreciation of the impact of their architectural decisions on the realization and operation of a solution.

A Certified Enterprise Architect's experience must include the understanding and appreciation of the solution lifecycle from strategy, design, and implementation through to completion, enabling the them to produce solution designs that are successful.

Certified Enterprise Architects must have completed formal training in the discipline of architecture (i.e., methods/frameworks for designing and defining enterprise architectures), either through attendance at a taught course, or through self-study.
Certified Enterprise Architects must continually develop their technical and professional knowledge and skills in technology trends, vertical industry sectors, and architecture trends and techniques.

Candidates must already hold valid Open CA Level 1 (or 2)  Professional Communication and  Professional Development Milestone Badges plus two Open CA Level 1 Experience Profile Milestone Badges, at least one of which must be in Enterprise Architecture

3d49ed92-4088-4c86-a447-cc01bf9a807d.description: Professional Technical Specialists need to be able to effectively communicate topics related to their specialty both verbally and in writing – topics that are critical for the continuation of their work. At Level 1, support and mentoring is allowed. (Open CTS PC L1)
3d49ed92-4088-4c86-a447-cc01bf9a807d.name: Professional Certification: Level 1 Technical Specialist - Professional Communication Milestone

badge_template_activities.title: Professional Technical Specialists exhibit good written communication of topics related to their Specialty, including the use of proper grammar, spelling, document organization, clarity, and use of appropriate content for the audience to meet its purpose.

Professional Technical Specialists exhibit good verbal communication, with responsiveness to questions, ability to stay on subject, use of good feedback, and follow-up questions, etc., leading to effective two-way communication. Culturally-appropriate body language is expected in face-to-face meetings and video teleconferencing.
This milestone badge is open to all applicants.  There is no requirement for any previous badge or certification.

d888eb37-2eee-4958-b721-0d6195010828.description: At Level 1, Technical Specialists are required to have undergone training in Project Management and in their Specialty, and to regularly develop their professional knowledge and skills. (Open CTS PD L1)
d888eb37-2eee-4958-b721-0d6195010828.name: Professional Certification: Level 1 Technical Specialist - Professional Development Milestone

badge_template_activities.title: Professional Technical Specialists must have completed formal training in Project Management either through attendance at a taught course, or through self-study.

Professional Technical Specialists must maintain their knowledge of the technology, trends, and techniques in the IT industry, and must undergo 40 hours per year of training, at a taught course or through self study, related to their Specialty.
Application is open to all applicants. There is no requirement for any previous badge or certification.

3760f938-cbb2-4c73-8b33-eb161db299b2.description: Professional Data Scientists at Level 3 are required to continually develop and maintain their skills and knowledge in the profession and to contribute to the growth and vitality of the Data Science Profession itself (Open CDS PD L3).
3760f938-cbb2-4c73-8b33-eb161db299b2.name: Professional Certification: Level 3 Data Scientist - Professional Development Milestone

badge_template_activities.title: Professional Data Scientists at Level 3 must continually develop and maintain their knowledge of the technology trends that are relevant to developing solutions for solving business problems, so that they are able to leverage that body of knowledge into feasible solutions.

Professional Data Scientists  at Level 3 must continually develop and maintain an understanding of their clients' businesses as it pertains to their clients' vertical industries (e.g., telecoms, financial, etc.).
Professional Data Scientists at Level 3 must continually develop their skills and knowledge of the latest data science-related trends and techniques.

Professional Data Scientists at Level 3 are required to make contributions to the Data Scientist Profession by, for example, publications, teaching, contributions to open source, research collaboration, or participation in professional organizations.

Professional Data Scientists at Level 3 are expected to contribute to the growth of the community of professional Data Scientists through teaching, serving on peer review boards, coaching, and/or mentoring.

Applicants are strongly advised to have been Certified at Level 2, Master Certified Data Scientist, before applying for this Milestone Badge.  See document X1821 in The Open Group Library for more information.

bc1e9207-cf1a-488e-876f-096880bd227c.description: Badge holders have acquired the skills to teach the foundational set of concepts for the Digital Practitioner. They are able to provide guidance for individuals who wish to create and manage product offerings with an increasing digital component, or lead their organization through Digital Transformation. They have been assessed to ensure they have the skills to effectively communicate the information to candidates.

42bb7453-1501-4836-9148-84bd80ee9a17.name: Professional Certification: Level 1 - Certified Architect - Business

Certified Architects must have at least 2 years of experience of contributing to the development of the architectural aspects of one or more  projects or engagements, possibly with support or mentoring, and must have participated in the role of Architect in two successful, complex architectural engagements or projects.

Certified Architects must have a variety of experiences that demonstrate their contribution to successful solutions to complex problems (covering e.g., business vision, mission, business logic, ambition) with some operational aspects (e.g., people, process, technology, management) involving one or more dimensions  (products, technologies, services, processes, management, security, governance, etc.) and/or domains (Business, Data, Information, Application, Technology, Security, Integration, etc.)

Certified Architects must have completed formal training in the discipline of architecture (i.e., methods/frameworks for designing and defining business architectures), either through attendance at a taught course, or through self-study.
Certified Architects must continually develop their technical and professional knowledge and skills in technology trends, vertical industry sectors, and architecture trends and techniques.

badge_template_activities.title: Master Certified Digital Architects achieve Certification by successfully completing three interviews by other Level 2 or Level 3 Certified Architects, based upon a comprehensive package of information describing project and other experiences.  The criteria used to decide on certification include all of the Skills mentioned above.  At Level 2, Architects must be able to demonstrate these skills at a "deep" level, having mastered the state of the art.

Master Certified Digital Architects must have at least 3 years of  Architecture work experience in one or more projects or engagements in which they were accountable for the  Architecture aspects and must have performed in the role of Lead Architect on successful architectural engagements or projects that met their acceptance criteria.

Master Certified Digital Architects have a variety of experiences that demonstrate their ability to deliver successful solutions to complex problems covering e.g., people, process, technology, and management, and involving at least four dimensions (products, technologies, services, processes, management, security, governance, etc.) and/or domains (Business, Data, Information, Application, Technology, Security, Integration, etc.)

Master Certified Digital Architects must have experience producing solutions/business-related change that involves different types of systems/architectures and multiple hardware and software platforms

A Master Certified Digital Architect's experience must include the solution lifecycle from strategy, design, and implementation through to completion, enabling the Architect to produce solution designs that are successful.

Master Certified Digital Architects must have completed formal training in the discipline of architecture (i.e., methods/frameworks for designing and defining  architectures), either through attendance at a taught course, or through self-study, and are expected to continue to develop their skills and to stay up-to-date with the development of their profession.
Master Certified Architects must continually develop their technical and professional knowledge and skills in technology trends, vertical industry sectors, and architecture trends and techniques.

Master Certified Architects must make contributions to the architecture profession; for example, architecture-related publications, research collaboration, development of training, or contributions to standards bodies or professional organizations.  They must also contribute to the development of professional architects through teaching, serving on certification boards, coaching, and/or mentoring.

Candidates must already hold valid Open CA Level 2 Professional Communication and  Professional Development Milestone Badges plus  three Level 2 Experience Profile Milestone Badges, at least two of which must be in Digital Architecture

f6eec6fb-4a42-4df6-824a-4e45db09c87b.description: Earners of this badge have attended the FACE™ Data Modeling Training Course and have gained knowledge from a technical perspective of the Data Modeling Concepts within the FACE Technical Standard, the FACE Data Architecture Data Model Language, FACE Data Model types, and the FACE Data Model structure. f6eec6fb-4a42-4df6-824a-4e45db09c87b.name: FACE™ Data Modeling Training Course — Attendee

Individuals who have completed this training course will have knowledge and understanding of: Key FACE technical documents; terminology and architectures that are relevant to FACE Data Modeling; the FACE Data Architecture Data Model Language; the Shared Data Model (SDM) and its concepts; the Domain-Specific Data Model (DSDM) and its concepts; model groupings; how to apply Data Modeling Elements; and how to apply FACE Data Modeling using a practical example.

— A minimum of one (1) year of relevant training experience
— Completed a train the trainer program that meets the criteria documented in Section 3.2 of The Open Group Certification for People: Training Course Accreditation Requirements

badge_template_activities.title: The earner has completed the Learning Units defined in the Conformance Requirements document and passed the assessment.
Applicants are required to hold a TOGAF certification at the Foundation level or higher.
The path to achieve this certification credential is to complete the Learning Units defined in the Conformance Requirements document and a pass result for the assessment.
Candidates are required to have passed the assessment made available by The Open Group. For details see The Open Group website.
The duration of the credential is indefinite – this credential is to a given version of the Body of Knowledge and does not expire, so there are no re-certification or renewal requirements.
